description:
Platform.sh the award-winning PaaS solution from Paris, France, is looking for talented solutions architects and technical presales wizards who are passionate about helping customers succeed with cloud technologies.


Our customer base spans thousands of web applications in > 100 countries consuming 10s of thousands of CPUs on four different public clouds. We were shipping containers before Docker, our sales team can explain the CAP Theorem, and our marketing director programs Haskell. We're hardcore technologists with equally hardcore customers. 


We can clone whole running systems, including the state, services, and topology in a matter seconds, but we want to be able to run that on any developer’s local box. Want to help our customers apply that to their needs?


The main API to operate and orchestrate our clusters of LXC containers is Git; our customers need on-boarding and training before they can master the Platform.sh fu. Can you deliver breathtaking and exhilarating tech demos, and explain the intricacies of command line tools?


We need to automate more of the Puppet magic. We need to have more auto-healing on the high-availability clusters. We need more performance out of our multi-protocol ssh proxy. We need work on our CEPH Implementation; We need to get our fabulous Debian package generation streamlined and faster. We need… great ideas on how to make Platform.sh even better, and someone who can help our customers overcome the bumps in the road. Interested? Join us!


We are searching in North America and in the UK (2 positions). Occasional travel to places like Paris, France, may be required.

Our team is focused on building solutions to enable business customers to research, discover and buy business, industrial and scientific products in large catalogs; across multiple devices, marketplaces and regions. Our customers include individual professionals, businesses and institutions that buy in either high frequency or in bulk quantities. Our customers have different needs than the traditional Amazon customer base. Your will be part of a team that is responsible for all aspects of the customer experience - from the visual interface to the back end services. Our systems need to meet remarkably high standards of quality, performance and reliability, operating around the clock on a massive scale. You are a talented, detail, oriented and enthusiastic SQA who is passionate about quality and is enthusiastic about the new cutting edge technology offered to consumers.



QAE test code at the user level, both manually and with automated tools. Our QAE are not pure black box testers; they are more grey box, able to understand software internals, debug problems using log files, and write automated tests with Perl/Java scripts and/or user-level automated tools. QAE work with Software Development Engineers to understand features and technical implementation. QAE should also work with groups such as Product Management, User Interaction, and Customer Support to understand customer usage models and develop test plans and suites that approximate real-world environments and regression tests and driving the software development process towards quality-centric methodologies.

* Strong knowledge of Agile or Scrum development methodologies

description:
What you would do: Oblong's Solutions team builds immersive custom experiences that seamlessly knit together millions of pixels across multiple surfaces, screens, and interaction modes.  Most other interaction programming is done in flatland or small 3D islands; we build interfaces at scale, in one unified frame of reference that is measured in meters rather than pixels. This position is based in our Boston office. 


In this role you would program Oblong spatial experiences in C++ (with additional Javascript, Python, and Ruby as needed). You might find yourself optimizing low-level asset-handling algorithms one day, and the next day working through the details of a UI problem presenting 2D and 3D data across a 40' wall display coupled with a touch table.


You would move comfortably between developing new application features; working with our clients to validate and refine those features; and coming up with new ways to stress test and integration test those same features, in their complex interactions with different components in a room-sized system. You would learn as you go, creating new components and abstractions that help the whole team do it better the next time around.


You have the ability to self-manage: you can take a small project from start to finish with little oversight. You have a demonstrated record of doing so.


You prefer software solutions that are simple (as opposed to convenient, familiar, or conventional). Your code avoids side effects and mutation.


You have strong communication skills; in fact, you instinctively feel that the job isn't done until it's documented and packaged so that others can follow in your footsteps.


 Required:


• Fluency in C++ or other systems-capable language
• Fluency in a dynamic language such as Python, Ruby, JS, etc.
• Minimum 5 years experience delivering production-quality code, preferably with 3D graphics involved
• Ability to communicate very effectively in writing and in person
• Proficiency in Unix
• Willing to travel 5-10%
• Bachelor’s degree (engineering discipline preferred)


Nice to have:


• Real world experience with the modern OpenGL rendering pipeline
• Creative coding experience (OpenFrameworks, Cinder, etc.)
• Scars from having worked with audio or video pipelines


Benefits and perks:


• Competitive compensation package of salary and stock options
• A healthy work environment -- no "work hard play hard" nonsense
• Medical, dental, and vision insurance
• 401K plan

description:
Wanna work with a bunch of assholes?


Neither do we.


Good Character = Good Culture


At Engagency, culture is the natural result of attracting good people. We believe that a good company culture depends as much on what you give, as what you get. It’s the character of each individual that defines us. It’s our values and motivations that bind us. It’s something that each member of our team has the privilege and the responsibility to help define, nurture and protect.


Help us save the web.


At Engagency, you will use C# to make the web a better place. You will build and integrate C#/MVC/Enterprise IT/Cloud applications with Sitecore, the world's leading .NET enterprise web content management system (WCMS). You will help create digital marketing and commerce experiences that are so responsive, helpful, and relevant, that buying almost feels like a joy. We call that a “MeCommerce Experience” and you will get paid to bring a personal touch back to the buying process, for millions of people every day.


Call us idealists, but we don’t think it’s too much to ask...


We're looking for hardworking C# / .NET developers with curious minds and servants' hearts.



  • This is no brochure site/Wordpress shop. We’re helping $500M - $10B companies deploy, enhance, and support Sitecore, the most sophisticated and highly rated .NET web content management and digital marketing platform in the industry.

  • We're looking for people who are self-motivated and don't require coddling or micro-management to go the extra mile.

  • We’re building an elite team of web architects, developers, data analysts, and support engineers, fit to serve the world's leading companies.


PLEASE NOTE: WE ARE NOT ACCEPTING REMOTE APPLICANTS


This position is located on the south side of downtown Austin Texas and is on-site only. At Engagency, we believe that people do their best work when they have a team of people to collaborate and coordinate with, in person. We find that work is more meaningful when it's done with a sense of community, and you have a good group of people to share lunch and talk with every day. We work hard to find good people to work with. If you're looking for more than a job, we look forward to hearing from you.


WORK VISA SPONSORSHIP


We are open to considering TN sponsorship for citizens of Canada and Mexico. However, we are unable to provide H1B sponsorship at this time.


RECRUITERS


We are unable to work with candidates represented by a third party at this time. We ask that all recruiters respect our policy and do not contact us.

description:
Req ID: 68599

Java Enterprise Edition (JEE) Lead Developers/Architects

Ericsson Athlone is responsible for creating the world class software systems which allow mobile operators manage, optimize and analyze their networks.

The Ericsson Software Campus in Athlone has over 700 Engineers onsite and is the OSS (Operator Support System) headquarters within Ericsson globally and the main development centre for OSS and OSS RC Product lines. The OSS is the global market leader in mobile telecoms network management. The OSS system is delivered into 320 operators in 150 countries and manages over 1 Billion subscribers.

We have recently started a new project which will be the next generation of the Ericsson OSS offerings. This new deployment is being developed in cutting edge JEE technologies, with a web based front end being developed in HTML5 and CSS3.

Here is a video of the Ericsson Software Campus: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZiyVS5_-Eg0

We are looking for Java Enterprise Edition Lead Developers/Architects to join this new project. The role will be based in our Campus in Athlone and you will work as part of a feature team, developing in a full agile process using Scrum methodology.

The job will involve leading a team of Java Developers building Scalable, highly-available Management features for 3G and 4G Networks. Working in an Agile manner, you will drive the implementation of customer features using Java Enterprise Edition (JEE).

  • Very good hands-on knowledge of JEE environment (at least JEE5. JEE6 is preferred)
  • Hands-on experience with EJB 3.x (SLSB, MDB, SFSB) and JMS in general. Practical knowledge of best coding/design practices and patterns, optimizations, scaling and clustering
  • Hands-on experience with clustering in JEE environments, HA, replication and scale-out of backend JEE components
  • Hands-on experience with at least one major JEE application server is required (JBoss is an advantage). Basic configuration and administration, deployment and optimization.
  • Experience with distributed caching (Coherence, Infinispan) and other NoSQL systems
  • Experience with REST and/or SOA
  • Experience with workflow engines and business rules engines/CEP engines
  • Knowledge of JMX, RMI, JCA, JPA, JTA, SQL, JEE security
  • Knowledge of web GUI technologies (especially GWT) would be considered an advantage
  • Basic Linux/Unix knowledge

The following certifications are desirable:

  • Sun/Oracle Certified Enterprise Architect (SCEA)
  • Sun/Oracle Certified Business Component Developer (SCBCD)
  • Sun/Oracle Certified Web Component Developer (SCWCD)
  • Sun/Oracle Certified Master Java SE 6 Developer
  • Sun/Oracle Certified Programmer Professional

Please submit your details via our careers page http://www.ericsson.com/careers

*LI-BV1

To apply, please email your CV to barry.vickers@ericsson.com or use the links here.

Primary country and city: Ireland (IE) || Westmeath || Athlone || ProdMgt

description:
We are a world leader in fleet management!


Your job is to create a Web based application that makes sense of the data collected by our state of the art hardware.  We receive detailed data and metrics for hundreds of thousands of vehicles every second, which is processed and interpreted to create actionable information for our customers. You will write JavaScript (or maybe TypeScript!) code to create fast and responsive user interfaces. You will write high performance  C# code and SQL queries to process and store this information in real-time. Using Google BigQuery you will develop tools for analysis, such as iPython scripts to make sense of all the production data. Understanding the performance impact of designs, threading, good UI design and scalability will make you successful and help us build robust software that can function 24/7 with no down time.


Specifically your job will include the following:



  • Prepare detailed technical design of software components and systems architecture based requirements and prepare all related documentation.

  • Carry out coding and unit testing in a variety of programming languages and environments.

  • Participate in the design and development of new product ideas, concepts, prototypes and proofs of concept.

  • Contribute to high level product design and definition.

  • Evolve and extend existing product features using an agile software development approach.

description:
The HubSpot Java Platform and Libraries team strives to make our backend developer experience as fast and easy as possible and aims for uniformity, robustness, and scalability across our backend services. We work on the core libraries and architecture that power the hundreds of Java microservices behind HubSpot, ranging from REST APIs to Kafka consumers and Spark jobs. We also define best practices, drive adoption, and provide support when engineers have questions or run into an issue.


For example, we built our own service discovery library that transparently routes HTTP requests to the nearest server. We also integrated Hystrix into all of our network calls to help prevent cascading failures across our distributed systems. And last year we upgraded all of our code to Java 8 and wrote a blog post about the joys of being early adopters.


This coming year, we have a few big projects lined up, including:



  • Complete the roll-out of Blazar, the open-source continuous integration platform we built

  • Design the next iteration of HubSpot’s REST API stack and migrate our 250+ APIs to it

  • Investigate Gradle as an alternative to Maven

  • Refactor our 1,200+ Guice modules so we can run in production stage

  • Help onboard the 50+ engineers we plan to hire this year by providing a mix of documentation, workshops, and support

When it comes to processing seismic data at petascale with our proprietary imaging software and our world-class data center, infrastructure is an integral part of delivery. Our users’ job is to accurately image the subsurface to improve our knowledge of the earth and mitigate drilling risk. You are the one who controls how quickly and efficiently they do this. Our infrastructure team is responsible for implementing the framework that delivers our various software services. You will be responsible for designing and developing a system that allows our multi-petabytes of data to be accessed and stored quickly and easily. Doing this requires great knowledge of data structure and I/O. The team also develops and maintains the libraries - shared components and technologies - that are used by our high-end imaging code and visualization applications.


Your work has wide-sweeping implications for global subsurface imaging at CGG, so your work needs to be impeccable. description:
Have you ever had a dream so real you felt awake?  Where you helped decide how to build an awesome product in a sweet location with smart, cool developers?  Take the red pill and come join the Bluebeam engineering team.



Our engineers develop intuitive applications that revolutionize how people collaborate and share data in real time. As part of the Bluebeam team, you will use your expertise to design and develop customer centric applications. You will work in a fast-paced environment were product delivery cycles are measured in months rather than years. You won’t ever see a 300-page specification document here.  Instead, we work closely with product managers and customers to extend core functionality as well as design and implement new products and features that make a difference every day for our users.



As part of the development team, you’ll work with Xamarin to develop native Mac OS X and iOS applications. You’ll help us solve complicated problems in areas such as code sharing across platforms, graphics performance, and intuitive interface design.  



(At this point, you’re thinking, “What the frak?! C# development on Mac and iOS??” So here’s the deal:  Bluebeam is dedicated to a multi-platform experience. Xamarin lets us share code between native Windows, iOS and OS X applications while maintaining the look and feel of the native UI.  Trust us, it works great!)



In summary, if you are looking for a career where you can develop applications that provide best-in-class functionality and have a direct impact on some of the largest design and engineering projects, Bluebeam is the place for you. 



What you’ll do



  • Collaborate with your team and other stakeholders to produce high quality code

  • Assist in the design, development, testing, and deployment for one of following applications:

    • the Mac version of Revu (our Windows flagship application )

    • iOS applications for iPad and iPhones





What we’d like to see in you



  • Bachelor’s degree or higher - Computer Science or equivalent field

  • 3+ years of software development experience

  • Proven development experience using Windows .NET technologies particularly C#

  • Knowledge of one dynamic scripting language (Python, PowerShell, Ruby, Perl, JavaScript)

  • Must have experience developing end-user software

  • “Agile” software development methodology experience and test-driven development experience

  • Experience using OO methodologies in designing software solutions

  • Take pride in writing clean dependable code

  • Strong ability to analyze problems and formulate effective solutions

  • Sharp critical thinking skills, including systems and business analysis, problem analysis and resolution, and sound judgment/decision making ability

  • Proven ability to work in a rapid release product environment

  • Xcode and Objective-C familiarity

  • Mac OS X development experience ( not a deal breaker )

  • Enjoy working on a Mac OS X system



If you think you are a good match for the Bluebeam team, please send us the following:



  • Resume

  • A Cover letter that reflects your personality and your interest in Bluebeam and this role specifically (no generics please!)

description:
Who we are


At Jibestream, we have a platform that helps our customers improve people’s Experience of Place. We do this by enabling them to provide people with the most up-to-date and relevant information based on where they are and where they are going. Today, it’s all about the mobile device, being location-aware, and killer business rules that keep us the best at what we do.


We have graduated from a fast growing start up to playing in the big leagues with rapid global expansion. The pipeline is strong and is comprised of Tier 1 companies looking to deploy across entire networks; the product is the best in the market.


Now all we need to win is to continue growing our A team. Traction and product can be developed – finding amazing people is the single hardest part of building a success story. We take our culture and our people very seriously.


What's our tech stack?


Our application runs on cloud hosted Restful Webservices leveraging the latest distributed architecture technologies. Our deployment tools include Jenkins and HockeyApp. We develop our mobile applications and mobile SDKs using Objective C for iOS and Java for Android. Our mobile SDKs are used by our partners and customers to embed our mapping engine into applications built in both Objective C and Swift.  Other technologies we work with include Javascript for Web SDK.


What problem are we trying to solve with this role?


We have an amazing opportunity to enhance to the user’s mobile experience of our wayfinding solutions. We want our mobile wayfinding software to look and feel like our favourite games. Now we just need someone who can do that! We need to find the best mobile  developer in the market who shares our vision and super-high standards to join our team.


What we’re looking for


Technology is at the core of all our products, and the right candidate will share our enthusiasm. We are cutting edge, and it reflects in our product. We’re looking for a passionate Lead Mobile Developer who can work in a tightly knit Agile team environment directly with both Android and iOS developers. We only work with the best and brightest. You’ll be joining a multi-disciplinary team, working closely with other software engineers, product managers, project managers and graphic designers, or, as we like to call them, Tech’s Mightiest Heroes. We need a Lead Mobile Developer who is:


Tech savvy: We need someone who lives and breathes Mobile technology.  Someone who can push past the front end of the application and get right to the guts of how it works. As the virtual owner of Jibestream’s mobile development, you will be all, know all, share all, and get it all done.  This is your world and you will build it.


Insightful: We need someone with insights into what the user’s mobile experience should look and feel like.  Someone who understands the expectations of next generation app users; and how to blend that with easy-to-use functionality for the rest of the population.


Awesome: We need someone who gets it, who believes in it, and who enjoys sharing the love, or just the plan. Our team is super smart and resourceful, if you frame up the problem properly, together you will strategize and solve it.


And here’s what you are looking for, you want to:



  • Be amazed: As a lead Mobile developer you will get to see the things you have built be deployed and change the way people interact with our space.  You will continue to be wowed by how quickly we adopt new technologies and just how fun and cool indoor mapping is.

  • Be committed. This is the long-term career opportunity you have been seeking.  A chance to take your gaming skills, both as a developer and as a player, and use them for good. And to make money.

  • Be challenged.  You will have the chance of a lifetime to push Mobile to its very limits.  

  • Be passionate.  You love what you do and you will love who you are doing it with.  Creating quality solutions for exciting clients, with a group of amazing developers. Our team truly wants our tech solutions to be the best in the world.  That’s how hard we work.

  • Be something of a wish-granter. Whether it’s a new functionality or an upgrade, you will continuously explore ways to improve current and future releases of our products.

description:
Doxim is a leading provider of Customer Engagement Software for Financial Service Organizations. The Doxim Customer Engagement Platform helps financial institutions digitize their client experience, communicate more effectively throughout the client lifecycle and improve cross sell and upsell activities to drive increased wallet share.


Right now we have our eyes on the prize. We have an aggressive revenue goal over the next five years and to meet it we are focused on breaking into the US wealth management and banking markets. The potential here at Doxim, is huge, and we want energetic, enthusiastic, dedicated people to join our teams.


To that end, we are expanding, and we need a new key member of our DevOps team, someone with a developer or QA background who wants to jumpstart their career in the exciting and challenging world of DevOps.


Our DevOps team is just 18 months old and made up of 4 fantastic team members who are pretty confident they have the best job in the company.  With an opportunity to combine testing, IT, financial services, and SaaS knowledge, our DevOps team is in the exciting position of raising the red flag or the green one.  We want someone customer service focused with strengths in testing, problem solving, and collaboration.  A Junior DevOps Developer who can learn our technologies quickly and apply their existing knowledge to help us develop, test, and launch multiple new platforms annually as we scale and grow.


If you are looking for an opportunity to move out of QA or application development and start growing a career in DevOps, increase your knowledge in technology and financial services, and make a difference in the work you do everyday, this role is one to consider. If you want to avoid the commute into downtown Toronto, Doxim’s Markham office is the place to be.


Here’s what our new Junior DevOps Engineer will work on:



  • The organization’s application infrastructure.  You will build, manage and lead the administration of the organization’s application infrastructure.

  • Strategic plans to help us scale.  You will manage and implement short and long term strategic projects to ensure application infrastructure capacity meets existing and future requirements.

  • Level 3 application issues.  You will triage Level 3 application issues in a timely and accurate manner.

  • Big picture improvements.  You will benchmark, analyze, report on, and make recommendations for the improvement of applications.

  • Test plans.  You will evaluate test criteria, create and execute tests to determine if new releases of software are acceptable for implementation in SaaS.environment.

  • Disaster recovery.  You will manage and plan disaster recovery and business continuity activities.

  • Deployment and maintenance.  You will provide technical leadership, making decisions in deployment and maintenance methodologies.

  • Security enhancements.  You will coordinate the security enhancements across applications.

  • Operational features and processes. You will collaborate with Development Architects and leaders to implement operational features, tools and process.

  • IT-related tasks. You will working closely with IT and assist with IT related tasks.

As a Java Developer, you will be responsible for building the backbone for the Vena platform, building REST web services with a very modern Java 8 backend stack. 


We are seeking innovative, analytical software engineers with an aptitude for big data, machine learning and server-side development who love to be continually challenged to create scalable and performant code.  You will work with a team of passionate, talented software engineers who love solving hard problems to build highly scalable web services, real-time systems, resilient services and so much more.


Our developer focused team culture encourages our engineers to be self motivated and self directed. We value leadership and people with passion who will take ownership to make their mark on our product within this growing business space.


Check out the team blog for more details at engineering.vena.io


What you will do



  • Write code with the freedom to explore new tools, techniques, and languages that interest you

Allegory Law is a legal tech startup gaining traction with many of the top law firms and in-house legal departments in the country.  We spend 100% of our time growing the business, as we no longer need to raise money and are able to support the business with revenue.  In addition to our direct client relationships, we have deals worth hundreds of thousands of dollars with leading legal services providers.  We work closely with our clients to identify the best ways to take Allegory to the next level and have some great momentum.  We recently added to our engineering team and are looking for one more.


Allegory is built primarily in Ruby-on Rails.  It is a robust, document-heavy application using a PostgreSQL database.  OCR is built into our document pipeline.  For search, we use Elastic Search.  Our main application is cloud-based, hosted on Amazon AWS, but in some cases, we have deployed and will deploy on-prem.  We practice test-driven development, using RSpec and a continuous integration server.  We also use agile development methods, using Git and Jira for our code and project management.

title: Lead Software Engineer (React.js a plus) at Appian Corporation (Reston, VA)

description:
Overview


Azavea is a civic technology firm that uses geospatial data to build software and data analytics for the web.  We’re excited about what we do, we're growing, and we hope you will join us.


 Azavea is based in Philadelphia, and we are looking to grow our Urban Ecosystems team that develops our OpenTreeMap product as well as our projects related to urban forestry and digital humanities.



We are looking for


We’re looking for a software engineer that is passionate about building applications that will have a positive impact – someone interested in public service, but not necessarily in working for a government or a non-profit organization.  We are looking for someone who thrives on working in a variety of technology environments, and wants to build visually slick applications that have well-engineered architectures and provide a responsive user experience.



Who we are and what we’re doing


As a B Corporation, we’re committed to working on projects that have social and civic impact and advancing the state-of-the-art through research.  Most of our customers are local governments, non-profit organizations. and academic or federal research projects.  We build custom apps; perform geospatial analysis; manage several open source civic software projects (DistrictBuilder, OpenTreeMap and others); and develop an open source, high performance computing framework, GeoTrellis, that enables us to build fast analytical applications by distributing the geospatial data processing.  Our developers work across the technology stack from database and application servers in the infrastructure layer to modern, browser-based front-ends. 



The Urban Ecosystems Team


Azavea has five software teams, all of which develop web mapping applications that use geospatial data.  The teams differ in terms of the specific projects they develop and whether they are primarily product teams or professional services teams.  The Urban Ecosystems team works on a couple of custom software projects related to urban forestry and digital history, but its primary focus is on developing and supporting OpenTreeMap, an open source SaaS product for tracking urban street trees and other green stormwater infrastructure as well as assessing the ecosystem services impact (stormwater, energy savings, carbon sequestration, air quality, and other impacts).  OpenTreeMap is sold to local and state government and non-profit organizations around the world.  It applies a mix of clever software, distributed processing, and AWS infrastructure to create a compelling urban ecosystem management tool for communities of all sizes.  The Urban Ecosystems team is particularly strong with Javascript, Python, PostgreSQL, and mobile applications.



What You’ll Do:



  • Implement application code, APIs, and web or mobile clients based on wireframes and designs developed by our UI/UX Design team.

  • Engage in multidisciplinary work that applies an agile process (scrum board, daily stand-ups, and two-week iterations) to database design, architecture, development, testing, and deployment.

  • Optimize database, server, and client performance to create applications with both functional and responsive user experiences.

  • Build, provision, and deploy servers in a repeatable way to AWS.

  • Respond to and assist the OpenTreeMap open source community.

  • Contribute to both a growing company and to the open source communities that support our work.


You should:



  • Know how to build and support scalable web applications in Python/Django, or another MVC framework (C#/.Net, Ruby/Rails, Java/JVM/Spring, Scala/Play). We do a lot of work in Python/Django, Javascript, and Scala and dabble in others depending on client and project requirements.

  • Demonstrate fluency in core web technologies (HTML/CSS/JS) and contemporary Javascript libraries like jQuery, React, or AngularJS.

  • Express solid understanding of MVC architecture, RESTful design patterns, and the DRY principle.

  • Be comfortable managing VMs and working in a Linux environment.

  • Be interested in working with a small, collaborative team on meaningful projects.

  • Get excited about a diversity of both projects and technologies.


You get extra points for:



  • Background in math and statistics or experience with R.

  • Experience with open source or commercial geospatial toolkits like OpenLayers, Leaflet, GeoServer, PostGIS, CartoDB, ArcGIS, and GoogleMaps.

  • Experience with mobile apps (Objective C, Android or responsive HTML).

  • Experience scaling apps within AWS.

  • Experience provisioning servers with Ansible.

  • Knowledge of distributed data processing frameworks, like Hadoop, Amazon MR, etc.

  • Demonstrating your open source or other community service contributions.

  • Background in projects related to sustainability and the environment.



You’ll notice that we don’t say “X-Y years of experience” or “M.S. in Computer Science.”  Formal credentials like these are not irrelevant, but we are primarily looking for people who have had experience successfully building sophisticated web applications.  You might have had these kinds of experiences without a college degree.  Or you may be just out of school but worked your way through school and had some great co-op experiences.  Or you might have a math or humanities background but a have a great head for software development.  These are all potentially great backgrounds, and we’d be interested in hearing from you.



Office and Benefits


Our Philadelphia office is located in a brightly lit office on the 5th floor of a converted factory building in the Callowhill neighborhood, a short walk from Center City, the Reading Terminal Market and SEPTA subway and regional rail stations. 


For bicyclists, we have in-house bike parking, a shower and lockers.  It’s an open office plan with several smaller rooms for team meetings, private space and concentration time. 


You get a top-end Linux workstation, Mac or Windows laptop with a pile of memory for VMs and extra monitors.  We have flex-time to deal with personal stuff, and most people work a 40 - 45 hour week on a regular schedule.  After the first six months, our developers can also spend up to 10% of their time on a geospatial open source, professional development, or R&D project. For example, some of our colleagues are contributors to the PostGIS, OpenLayers, GDAL and GeoTrellis projects.  Other research projects have included improving dev ops tool chains; using FFT for fast kernel density estimation; working with Spark to develop machine learning tools; and using GPUs for faster raster data processing.  Once a quarter, we all get together to share our research and learning with our colleagues.



We offer a salary commensurate with skills and experience and a benefits package that includes:



  • Fully subsidized health care, dental, prescription plan, including for spouse/partner and children

  • Fully subsidized life and long term disability insurance, plus voluntary short term disability insurance

  • Medical reimbursement plan to cover what the health insurance does not

  • Retirement plan with matching percentage

  • Almost 4 weeks paid vacation plus additional paid sick/personal time off

  • Family and medical leave

  • Flexible work schedule

  • Paid maternity and paternity leave

  • Child care subsidy

  • Paid time off for voting and volunteering

  • Education assistance plan

  • Student loan assistance

  • Public transit and biking reimbursement plans

  • Monthly guest lectures with lunches on the house

  • 10% time for Research or Training Projects

  • Profit-sharing bonus plan

  • Financial transparency through an open book policy

  • Kind, capable and thoughtful colleagues


 We welcome qualified candidates from all walks of life and value diversity in our company, and we prohibit discrimination based on race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, military service, disability unrelated to job requirements, marital status, or domestic partner status.

description:
Charles River Analytics is seeking a scientist well-versed in search and optimization techniques to conduct innovative research to address real-world challenges. In this position, this candidate will solve planning and optimization problems such as helping operators choose which is the best plan to execute from among alternative options, enabling teams of unmanned aerial vehicles to collaborate, and improving missile defense systems by efficiently tasking sensors in real-time.


The ideal candidate will have a range of research skills in search and optimization that can be applied to hard computational problems. Examples include graph and tree search algorithms (e.g., A*); discrete, combinatorial, and continuous optimization (e.g., vehicle routing problem); mathematical programming (e.g., linear programming), metaheuristics (e.g., simulated annealing, evolutionary algorithms), handling multiple objectives and constraints, multi-agent negotiation, and planning systems.  


At Charles River, scientists are key members of small, project-oriented teams of both scientists and software engineers that create software prototypes of new research concepts. Scientists help understand the problem, research approaches, design solutions, and evaluate the results. They connect with other researchers, publish papers, attend conferences, and communicate results through verbal and written means. They also help develop new artificial intelligence concepts and prototypes for domains such as military command and control systems, cyber security, unmanned vehicles, modeling and simulation, missile defense, intelligence analysis, human behavior modeling, and training. At, Charles River Analytics, we foster an environment where scientists are free to pursue their own research interests and are supported by a community of bright, enthusiastic individuals to help them thrive. 


Major Responsibilities / Activities:



  • Apply the state-of-the-art in current basic and applied research in relevant search and optimization disciplines

  • Identify and analyze domain challenges and user needs

  • Research, analyze, and design algorithms for decision-support systems and automation

  • Support engineering teams to develop technology solutions

  • Conduct technical discussions with customers

  • Write and contribute to proposals, research scientific papers, and present work at briefings and conferences


Requirements:



  • A Master’s (with at least 2 years of relevant experience) or PhD degree in computer science, mathematics, operations research, or a related field

  • Demonstrated ability to design, prototype, and evaluate algorithms

  • Ability to work independently as well as in a team environment


  • Strong verbal and written skills to support proposal writing, interaction with customers, and presentations at technical conferences



  • Familiarity with modern software languages and practices

  • U.S. Citizenship is required for this position


Candidates with the following skills will be favorably considered:



  • Experience working with US military and intelligence research organizations, including DARPA, ONR, AFRL, Army RDECOM, and IARPA and/or with other defense-related R&D companies

  • Experience with programming languages or technical computing software such as Java, Scala, Python, MATLAB, Solvers (e.g., GLPK, GAMS, CPLEX)

  • Experience with decision theory, multi-objective optimization, machine learning 

  • Experience with distributed/concurrent algorithms 

  • Experience with market/auction-based approaches, game theory, multi-agent coordination

  • A record of peer-reviewed publications

  • Experience with agile software development methodologies like Scrum

description:
Are you enthusiastic and creative? We are looking for a Senior Backend Engineer who will join our engineering team. TravelBird offers you extensive room for growth and a challenging opportunity in a young, fast growing and dynamic team!


Become part of our team


At TravelBird we believe that every day presents a chance to learn and grow. We challenge our people in a focussed, creative and dynamic environment. TravelBird believes in a positive and responsible way of working, which is clearly reflected in our open, social and entrepreneurial culture. Here, we learn from each other and value trust more than focussing on hierarchy. Our aim is to inspire travelers and make them lifelong fans. We create joy for travelers as well as for our employees. It’s not just a job, it’s an experience you will love to wake up to every day.


Your challenge


To keep our team updated we will start with a "stand-up". This not only improves communications but also simplifies your work and planning. During the day you will work with the team and CTO and create great software solutions. These solutions can be implementing great features we planned during our sprints or tightening the security of our website. This is mostly done with Python and the Django Framework. Of course you will get a lot of freedom to find your place within the company. Feel free to speak your mind about the current product, it's features or possible improvements and which direction we should take. Your input is greatly appreciated.

description:
Req ID: 123209

Reporting Lines

Reports to: Development Line/unit Manager

Works as: Interaction Designer (UX)

Position available at: Center Of Excellence at Gurgaon

Overview

Ericsson took the challenge to drive UX towards excellence for its leading BSS & OSS Solutions. Now is the right time for you to join our journey. For the user-centered design of our Operation/Business Support Systems we are looking for one Interaction Designer for our BUSS R&D India. As part of the Domain Architecture and Development teams you foster a culture of User Experience in the development process,, likewise you will be integrated in a global UX community driving for a consistency across our product suites. In close cooperation with Product managers, user researchers, architects, developers and testers you will design products that are valuable, support users’ tasks and goals efficiently and effectively, that are easy and appealing to use. The interaction designer transforms the user research results into professional user interface design.

<span style="font-family: "Arial", "sans-serif"; font-size: 11pt;"> Key Areas of Responsibility <span style="font-family: "Arial", "sans-serif"; font-size: 11pt;">

  • Take responsibility and drive the product design through the whole lifecycle, from early definition and analysis, to test and customer installation
  • Design and specify user interactions for our product applications via prototypes, GUI sketches, Mockups etc.
  • Work with user researchers to translate findings from user research and validate your design
  • Work collaboratively and communicate effectively your  designs with all stakeholders from product managers, architects, developers, testers to clients
  • Take a leadership role in guiding the agile teams in the development and test of world class user focused applications through reviews and acceptance criterias and backlog contributions
  • Socialize your designs in the UX communities and drive submissions of products to formal UX reviews
  • Evangelize and contribute to evolving our branding, user centered design ways of working, new interface guidelines and design patterns
  • Stay informed of advances in interactive techniques, technologies and methods, and adapting to rapidly evolving industry space

Qualification

  • Bachelor’s Degree degree in Interaction/Graphic Design, MA/MS in computer science, human computer interaction, industrial engineering, cognitive science, or related field,
  • 3+ years of industry work experience in UX driven development experience including proven experience with different UX deliverables (wireframes, user flows, sitemaps, design patterns, graphics) and the ability to adapt them to different uses, projects and constraints,
  • Prototyping tools (Balsamiq, Axure, JustInMind, … ),
  • Photoshop/Illustrator are a plus
  • Experience working in Agile environments highly desired,
  • Creativity and great attention to details & design,
  • HTML/CSS knowledge and and found understanding web development are a plus,
  • Knowledge of Operation/Business Support Systems, preferably with expertise in Product Development (design/test) or System Management / Requirement engineering
  • Strong and clear communicator both internally and externally,
  • Demonstrated and quantified successes applying principles of user centric design methodologies,
  • Must be able to provide an online portfolio that demonstrates ability to turn ideas into a strong and unique creative vision.

Position Summary

We are looking for passionate developers that are interested in using the latest web technologies HTML5, CSS3 and JavaScript frameworks such as AngularJS. If you’re ambitious, creative, and driven to work on difficult problems and provide innovative solutions, this is the position for you.

As a Senior Web UI Developer you will utilize expert knowledge and experience to perform complex product design, systems analysis, research, maintenance, troubleshooting and other programming activities. You will also be involved in assisting other team members by providing guidance on complex tasks.

It’s a plus to have business domain knowledge on Catalog Management, Order Management and Customer Management applications.

Responsibilities & Tasks

  • Develop Web UIs with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript using frameworks such as Angular.
  • Familiar with communication protocols – HTTP and RESTful architecture.
  • Produce high quality testable code according to design specifications. Testing frameworks include Selenium web driver.
  • Detailed technical design of highly complex software components based not only on requirements, but with scalability and performance in mind.
  • Participates in software design/code reviews to ensure quality and adherence to company standards and usability guidelines.
  • Mentor and collaborate with other team members.
  • Actively participate in the software development process from design to release.
  • Always have the best in class user experience in mind.

  • Minimum 5+ years development experience.
  • Detailed knowledge of JavaScript framework
  • Detailed knowledge of HTTL5, CSS3
  • Detailed knowledge of HTTP, REST API
  • Working knowledge of workflow concepts such as BPM, BPMN, BPML and BPEL.

description:
Req ID: 110594

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators and enterprises.  Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.

Ericsson has recently launched a disruptive cloud portfolio attacking all layers of the stack enabling cloud operators to effectively compete with the mega providers and enterprises to build their own secure private cloud with public cloud functionality and economics.   We need cloud experts to grow our business.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. Our employees live our vision, core values & guiding principles. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.

We welcome the opportunity to meet you!

Cloud Sales Specialist Job Summary

The Cloud Sales Specialist is responsible for taking the Ericsson Cloud System (ECS) to market in North America. ECS consists of a complete cloud stack solution including the HDS 8000 Hyperscale Server System, Ericsson’s OpenStack Distribution, Secure Storage, Object Storage, Platform as a Service, and Data Integrity.  You will target Cloud Service Providers, Channel Partners, Telecom Operators and Enterprises in a targeted manner pursuing qualified opportunities and “losing fast” when needed to stay focused on the right opportunities where Ericsson can win.

The Cloud Sales Specialist will work with across Ericsson leveraging teams in Consulting and Systems Integration, Business Unit Cloud, Ericsson Customer Units and other Ericsson Engagement practices. You may be an individual contributor, you may be required to lead cross-function, organizationally matrixes teams, and/or manage direct teams depending on the evolution of the business.  You will be working the sales teams and meeting with customers, with frequent domestic and occasional global travel.  Travel is expected to fluctuate throughout the year, be about 25% on average, and might peak at 50% during significant customer pursuits.

Responsibilities & Tasks

  • Identify target customers and develop opportunity pursuit plans
  • Conduct in-depth business focused discussions with the customer and sales teams & analyze customer business environments, requirements, plans & issues - understand requirements and quickly and thoroughly propose and architect solutions - Strong capability to frame and decompose customer problems (business & technology) and drive teams to scope out relevant solutions.
  • Be accountable for specific customers, specific opportunities, and/or incepting, cultivating and closing new business opportunities contributing to top and bottom line growth towards the group’s and Ericsson’s business objectives
  • Strong ability to lead engagements providing structure, clear directions and objectives for engagement teams - lead direct and indirect, virtual/cross-functional teams, seeking assistance within a large, complex organization on proposals, offer development, demos, proofs of concepts, strategy development, 3rd party solutions, etc.
  • Be a subject matter expert in Cloud, SDN/NFV and Orchestration solutions, including Ericsson and third party partner products - Perform value argumentation through generating customer business cases
  • Be a dynamic, inspirational, and positive evangelist and change agent within Ericsson and within Customer organizations
  • Read and respond to RFxs, develop solution architectures, customer offerings and presentation collateral, author white papers, marketing editorials, host solution webinars and participate and speak in industry events
  • Identify & proactively drive new business opportunities, including generate & managing leads to increase the 36 month sales funnel; Drive up selling in ongoing projects.
  • Identify strengths and weaknesses of Ericsson’s positioning vs. competition in any given situation through research, industry contacts, personal networks, etc.
  • Drive knowledge transfer among relevant communities within Ericsson - Ensure high level participation in global re-use and knowledge sharing.
  • Provide Competence Center business needs/requirements to ensure optimization of delivery and accurate forecasting of resources and competence.
  • Participate and represent Ericsson at industry forums such as the Openstack, OPNFV, and engage in media and analyst interviews and social media marketing efforts internally and externally

Qualifications & Experience Requirements:

  • Minimum of 7 years sales and/or sales support experience in cloud business models including public, private, hybrid clouds and virtualization
  • Thorough knowledge of Cloud commercial models, TCO, and make v. buy analysis
  • Thorough knowledge of SPI Model
  • Knowledge of Hyperscale datacenter architecture
  • Knowledge of server architectures including OCP
  • Strong communication, project management and presentation skills
  • Ability to prioritize activities and make objective decisions based on facts
  • Knows how to quickly qualify opportunities and to “lose fast” if needed
  • Thinks and acts like an owner of the business
  • Can develop go-to-market plans and opportunity pursuit plans
  • Familiarity with sales methodologies – e.g. TAS, Holden, etc. and outcome based selling techniques
  • Basic enterprise WAN architecture knowledge
  • Bachelors Degree

Additional Requirements:

  • Frequent domestic travel to customer locations and some international travel is required.

description:
We cherish our culture, so every hire we make is carefully considered. If you’re tempted by joining the Media Suite Team, be sure to read on and make sure our ideologies are aligned.


We are a team of curious-minded people who support each other, hold robust debates and don’t mind helping each other move house on the weekend. We thrive on challenges, we view our successes (and failures) as opportunities for growth, and we never, ever want to stop learning.


We value mindset over skillset and we believe the team is more powerful than the individual.


Our employment philosophy is simple. We look for the right people and then do what it takes to get them on board and keep them around. We aren’t scared to invest in the right people to help realise their potential.


If you were part of the Media Suite Team this past year, you might have:


Been Teacher and student:



  • Attended company-wide Agile training

  • Presented a topic at one of our “Learning Lunches” or local JS meetup.

  • Been dispatched to conferences in Norway, Australia, New Zealand or Scotland

  • Helped run the Southern Hemisphere's first NodeJS conference.


Built meaningful things:



  • Contributed to a government-backed system to help plan, coordinate and collaborate on the Christchurch rebuild

  • Developed a range of environmental science databases which help monitor New Zealand’s natural resources

  • Worked on a range of initiatives providing commuters with tools to reduce their commute time.


Had some fun:



  • Been involved with planning one of our ‘Media Suite Hack Days’

  • Eaten Yum Neua (pretty much any Wednesday)

  • Escaped to the Marlborough Sounds, with quite a few beers,  for a weekend of “user testing”

  • Communicated with our self-made robot who lives in our chat room; it has its own personality, gender and name (although these last two get changed frequently).


About the role:


You will be embedded into a multi-developer JavaScript team committed to a culture of testing, automation, peer review, knowledge sharing, professional development, remote working and embracing change.


About the work:


We build web applications for local and central government, national and international business, along with a handful of charitable organisations.


Our projects are generally interesting. They are large enough to get your teeth into, but not so big that you get bogged down forever.


We are excited to solve real world problems, actually making a difference in improving lives, the environment and efficiency.


How we work:


Our mandate is to build the right thing by combining thoughtful design with clever technology.


We use Agile methods (mostly based on Scrum) to deliver our projects and continually reflect upon and make improvements to our systems and processes.


Flexibility:


Talented creatives don’t necessarily want to live in the same city, working the standard 9-5 hours. In recognition of that, we’ve built and support a remote working culture.


Our HQ is in Christchurch, but we also have people in Wellington, Hamilton, Nelson, Queenstown, Melbourne, Munich and Oslo. They work from offices, homes, the kitchen table, ferries and airports.


Due to the diverse working locations (and time zones), we keep in close contact using tools like slack and screen hero. It takes planning and creativity to keep a cross timezone remote team humming - but we are committed to making it work.

description:
Job Profile:


Our Houston-based database team sets the global standards for data solutions. We don’t want people to maintain the status quo; we want people who creatively propose and develop new and better ways of doing things. Seismic imaging requires sophisticated systems for managing high-performance computing resources and large volumes of data. Our existing and next-generation systems make heavy use of ORACLE object-relational database technology to support large distributed databases that are optimized for fast and reliable transaction handling. As a database software developer, your primary role is to design and develop these key systems.


This role allows you to work as part of a geographically dispersed team to engineer and develop terabyte-scale systems. Our world-class data center has lots of resources and lots of computation to do, so resource scheduling is a big development priority. We also like forward-thinkers, who are constantly planning how to improve the scalability of our systems to meet future needs. Indeed, particular emphasis is on the scalability of the systems in light of anticipated step changes in the volumes of seismic data processed and the related computational demands of seismic imaging. Partner with our agile teams focused on HPC infrastructure and algorithm development to design and support the crème de la crème of seismic imaging computing at CGG worldwide. We’re a global team, and your work impacts the globe.

THE IMPORTANT STUFF:

At Hudson Laboratories, we know that life is short and so we work hard to make sure that you can focus on doing what you love and creating great products. We value forward-looking ideas and individuals who can leverage insights from across computer science to solve real world problems. Innovation and curiosity are in our DNA and we are committed to finding individuals who value both their work and their team. If you are self-starter who thrives on innovation and team camaraderie, wed love to hear from you!


THE DETAILS:

Hudson Laboratories is transforming how businesses and entire industries operate. By lending a critical eye to age old practices and business methodologies, we are bringing together the data and algorithms that allow us to solve real problems in new and innovative ways. As a senior software engineer at Hudson Laboratories, you will provide technical expertise and team leadership and will have the opportunity to be involved in multiple projects as our fast-paced business grows and evolves. You will work hand in hand with company founders architecting, developing and deploying robust, scalable data-backed web applications from the ground up.


REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • 3+ years software development experience
  • Fluency in JavaScript, Node.js, HTML, CSS, and SQL
  • Experience building web applications from the ground up
  • Experience deploying reliable user facing applications
  • Experience using structural client side web frameworks (Angular experience is a plus)

PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS:

  • Leadership experience

description:
Senior Front End Developer
Xero, San Francisco


Who is Xero?


We’re one of the fastest growing SaaS companies in the world. We are the leader in beautiful small business accounting and productivity software – complete with payroll, inventory and more. And we combine the dynamic pace of a startup with the security of $375M in funding. We’re ranked No. 1 by Forbes as the World's Most Innovative Growth Company for both 2014 and 2015.


We offer a competitive salary, shares in the company and a great office environment including endless ping pong matches, impromptu happy hours, and a killer roof deck overlooking the stunning San Francisco Bay.  


The Opportunity


Others consider you a rockstar!  You’ll be part of a top notch team of developers working on first of its kind cloud based payroll products.  You will make a huge contribution to innovative software that measurably improves the lives of small business owners around the world, as well as have a positive effect on the small business economy.  


What you’ll do


Work on front end development projects with our global Payroll and Employees team.


Collaborate in an Agile software development environment.


Display your passion for all things web, but have a special place in your heart for the modern web browser.  


Use your ability to pragmatically ship software while constantly challenging yourself and others to push boundaries.  


Have the opportunity to show that you care about user experience and take pride in your work.


Be a key player on an amazing team where you get to wear multiple hats.  


It’s time to introduce yourself


Now that we’ve caught your attention, it’s time to catch ours. Please apply if you:


Love doing #beautiful work – contribute to a beautiful user experience for our customers.


Show your passion for the #human side of software development through cultivating a deep understanding of the needs and aspirations small business owners.


Seek the #challenge of complex technical problems, crazy-smart collaborators and a fast-paced work environment.


#Champion creative development by bringing a unique point of view while inspiring impeccable work from others.

Take #ownership by driving meaningful change and delivering results with passion and purpose.


At a minimum, you should have:


Expert knowledge of Javascript and web technologies (HTML5, CSS, SASS)


Experience writing reusable UI components (React, Knockout, Web Components, etc)


Experience with:  modern MV* Frameworks (Angular, Ember, Aurelia, etc), Javascript modules (RequireJS, SystemJS, ES6, etc), modern Front End Dev Ops (NPM, Bower, Grunt, Browserify, Babel, etc).  


Bonus points if you have:


Experience with ES6, NodeJS, Express JS, GIT, Teamcity, AWS


 Xero is an Equal Opportunity Employer.

description:
Senior Delivery Manager

To manage 3 delivery managers how each manage several scrums, within the Software Engineering Capabilities function at Sky, Covering TV Services, Recommendations, Search and Programme Database. Ensuring the consistent on-time delivery of high quality software applications and the ongoing management of these systems in production.

The Delivery Manager will report to and provide advice and support to the Head of Technology. Delivery Manager will have line management responsibility for several Scrum Masters and other key delivery resources.

Key Responsibilities:
  • To lead and coach Scrum Masters, managing the delivery of the roadmaps and establishing and agreeing best practice to improve the predictability, efficiency and quality of software delivery
  • To build an effective working relationship with the Stakeholders requesting delivery from his/her team.
  • To educate business stakeholders on the benefits of agile delivery and influencing their behaviour to support this delivery method.
  • To ensure the adoption of Agile/XP methods within his/her scrums.
  • To act as the key contact within their area of delivery.
  • To manage delivery of projects across their scrums.
  • On a case by case basis to act as the lead delivery manager for projects that span various delivery managers within Sky Technology
  • To provide management reporting on the delivery status of their area. Balancing the requests for a defined delivery date, from stakeholders, with the agile delivery method.
  • Being aware of, and ensuring appropriate communication of, any delivery issues, dependencies and or risks to the roadmap.
  • To monitor and assess the demands for resources across their area and ensure appropriate staffing levels to meet the customer demands whilst ensuring effective & efficient delivery.
  • To support their Scrum Master in the communication of delivery and application support issues.
  • To work with senior leadership of other delivery streams inside and outside of the team to negotiate and agree how dependencies will be managed and assured.
  • To develop and coach delivery personnel to improve their personal and collective performance as Scrum Masters and Delivery professionals.
  • To be accountable for managing the quality and timeliness of the delivery across their Scrums.
  • To manage (with the help of their team, the Principal Software Engineer & Architects) the technical direction of their portfolio.
  • Work with integration partners (Broadcast and STB) to build better relationships and agree testing strategies.


Expertise Expected:
  • Use cutting-edge practices in Project Management, Product design, Requirement Analysis, Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration, Automation & Unit Testing in a software development environment.
  • Commercial experience in managing software development teams, with a least 18 months being in a commercial agile environment.
  • Proven capability in managing team dynamics, building team relationships, mentoring team members and delivering feedback.
  • Experience in release planning, estimation, capacity planning and managing project risks in a multi Scrum environment.
  • Direct Scrum Master experience.
  • Certified Scrum Master credentials are a plus.
  • Good at understanding complex technology intensive domains.
  • Exceptional listening, written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience with Extreme Programming , Scrum and other agile techniques.
  • Management experience of full life-cycle system development with teams of developers, analysts, and testers/QAs.
  • Awareness of one or more automated testing tools such as Silk Test, QTP, RFT or exposure to any open source testing tools such as Selenium, FitNesse etc.
  • An awareness and appreciation of current development tools and their usage.


Capabilities Specifics (Team Overview):

The Capabilities Group currently provide a number of online services to Web, Mobile and more recently the STB propositions, The teams are as follows:
  • TV Services
  • Recommendations
  • Search
  • Programme Database


To support this application set is a diverse set of technologies and skills from software engineering

Key Technologies and Challenges:

Due to the diverse array of applications this team provide and the sheer number of customers that make advantage of our services there is constant pressure to delivery more for less. Working with the business we need to change the way we are structured and deliver software. Recent integrations with the STB have brought about its own challenges with the risk adverse testing strategy and lengthy development cycles.

One of the key challenges in this area is this area is to deliver to scale, the current STB enjoys over 6 million connected users that are putting an ever increasing demand on the capabilities platform,

Specific Candidate Desired Attributes:

The successful candidate will be an excellent people manager and motivator and should be able to get the best out of a diverse team, by fostering collaboration and cross-fertilisation, where applicable. They should be experts in the agile process, and specifically be able to ensure the right level of discipline is maintained to ensure only quality software is delivered. They should also be able to creatively find solutions to operational challenges.

If you are appointed to this role you will be subject to the successful completion of a Criminal Record Check.

The Java Developer maintains a collection of Web Applications built with the popular Java and Spring stack running on Linux servers in the cloud.  The successful candidate will use his/her experience in Java, Spring, Hibernate, SQL, CSS, HTML, Javascript or similar technologies to update systems and design and implement new features.

The work environment is relaxed and casual.  The development process is agile with short sprints and daily stand-up meetings.  Remote work is available.  Minimal travel is required.  Flexible and/or extended hours may be required for deployment or troubleshooting.

description:
ABOUT TECKST

Teckst is a platform for businesses to receive and send text messages with customers. Started by leaders from Seamless and General Assembly, Teckst makes texting businesses as simple as texting friends. Gone are the days of calling to ask the hair shop if theyve got availability on Thursday at 5PM. Gone are the days of calling the airline to ask about flight change options. Gone are the days of calling the cable company to complain about slow internet speed. Gone are the days of calling businesses because, lets face it, theyre the only time you used your phone to make calls. Ever.

TL;DR

Teckst needs a dedicated Sr. Software Engineer who has a deep understanding of modern frameworks such as node.js, AngularJS as well as experience with HTML5 and CSS3 frameworks.


ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY

You will have the opportunity to live and breathe innovation every single day with Teckst. You are a natural born leader who has had experience helping other engineers grow and develop. Youve worked with on-shore and offshore teams, and have the ability to create a product from ideation to execution.

Teckst needs a dedicated Sr. Software Engineer who has a deep understanding of modern frameworks such as node.js, AngularJS as well as experience with HTML5 and CSS3 frameworks.

If you are that dedicated Sr. Software Engineer, we want to hear from you today!

Benefits


COMPENSATION:

  • Competitive salary + equity + cookies

BENEFITS:

All the standard perks such as medical, dental, vision, 401(k), funds for fitness/wellness, unlimited transit pass, and more! Were on the top floor of a building with innovative companies such as ZocDoc and Foursquare in the heart of SoHo. Theres ping pong, cold brew, a popcorn machine using coconut oil, a never-ending ice cream cart, freshly baked goods delivered regularly, and tons of free snacks. Plus, we give you time and funds to continue learning for things both in your field and things youve always wanted to learn even outside of it. We have a liberal work from home policy, and we believe that were all adults here at Teckst. So long as work gets done well, things like unlimited vacation and organic work hours are A-OK. Want to work from a beach in Miami? NBD so long as you wear sunscreen.

TripAdvisor, the world’s largest travel site, is looking for a talented senior software engineer in the native Android team. In this role, you'll be a driving force in the Android team. You will take the lead on key technical features, help others in the team with the harder problems, work closely with product on specs, and interface with the API and iOS teams to take the app to the next level. We iterate and deploy code fast, and everyone is looking at the impact that the team makes to our numbers.


We're rocketing up the hockey stick, playing with the coolest toys, and working on interesting problems that engage both the technical and aesthetic sides of the brain. We move quickly - projects are short (generally 3-7 days), and we have a new native release every month. The features you create will be used by millions of people every day. Trip is well known for having an extremely strong engineering organization - you'll be working with the best and getting stuff done, in the fastest growing area of an incredibly profitable, growing, fun company. Download our Android app and give it a spin!


The Facts


* Our apps are used around the world and have been download over 100 million times


* TripAdvisor has well over 100 million average monthly mobile unique visitors, which is doubling year-over-year


* We have over 3 million unique users / engineer, among the highest in the industry


* As mobile devices are replacing desktops and laptops as the standard for browsing the web, we have a unique opportunity as well as the market position to capitalize on enormous monetization potential


You Will


* Design complex systems and lead the technical solution of projects


* Work closely with our product and design teams to define feature specifications


* Be responsible for the code quality on your team


* Mentor more junior developers

description:
FULL STACK ENGINEER (Bangkok, Thailand)


HotelQuickly (HQ)  is Asia’s #1 mobile app for last-minute hotel booking. The app offers users a streamlined, swift and elegant tool for booking on the go, with room rates lower than anywhere online. Founded by an experienced team of serial entrepreneurs and investors, the company launched in March 2013. Today HotelQuickly’s booking network extends to 16 Asia-Pacific countries and 250 destinations across the region.


About you



  • You've built several projects and our initial assignments during the interview process will be a walk in a park for you ;-)

  • Hopefully you'll have some published code (in any language, on Git) that we can take a look at

  • Honestly, we don't really care about your level of formal education, math skill, and so on. We want to see that you know the shit

  • You want to be a part of a team creating a world-class application and creatively contribute to ongoing development.


The job and the challenges


We expect you to take ownership of some of our internal projects (we have dozens of git repositories at the moment). That means you should be doing the following:



  • watching trends and best practices in Node.js or PHP development

  • reading blogs and compiling ideas how to improve our Backend, Extranet and Frontend

  • attending meetups in Bangkok discussing some of the recent challenges and how to handle them

  • getting feedback about the system from our staff and making sure it's implemented

  • able to quicky implement new things requested by business / sales

  • able to work in a team with other Backend developers


On a more technical note, you need to know how to handle the entire software development life cycle, start to end, including working with the following:



  • Node.js framework

  • Frontend JS frameworks & libraries (Angular, React, jQuery, ...)`

  • SQL (some of our MySQL queries have 200+ rows)

  • large database (we have 200+ tables in the main project)

  • NoSQL database (we use both MongoDB and Redis for some internal Backend projects)

  • XML (unfortunately, some of the services we are connected to use XML)

  • JSON (used by most of the services we are connected to)

  • cache (we use Memcache and Redis)

  • CSS frameworks (we use Twitter Bootstrap)

  • Amazon AWS (we use EC2, RDS, S3, CloudFront, CloudFormation, ElastiCache, ...)

  • Platform as a service (Deis, Heroku)

  • version control repositories (preferably git)


So you need to be familiar with the following areas:



  • Languages: Javascript (Node.js), PHP

  • Frameworks: Angular, Express, Zend, Nette

  • Testing: Testing frameworks for the languages listed above

  • DevOps: Vagrant, Puppet, Chef, AWS, Jenkins, Travis. This extends into a familiarity with Linux OSes (Ubuntu is fine).

  • VCS: We stick to Git, but it can't hurt to be familiar with more

  • Database: MySQL and (MongoDB or Redis)


Working environment


You'll be working in our office in Bangkok, directly with all the other engineers and the tech co-founder. We have a beautiful office here full of snacks and Coke.


Our working hours are typically 10am-8pm, but it's pretty flexible. Some of us start early morning (8am), some of us start later and work until midnight.


We've got lots of fun at the office, check out what people say in the video below:



  • Video

    • How does it work at HotelQuickly?



  • Photos

    • Team photos

    • Office photos




Communication


We communicate over Slack. Sometimes even when we sit next to each other ;-) to not disturb each other when we're in the zone. In Slack, each topic or project has its own room and we use mentions to notify when there's something important. Jim is also posting there some funny .gif images.


Compensation


We're still small but we recognise that we need to pay well to get the talent we need. To really (I mean REALLY) good candidates we can offer equity.


But we offer much more to make you happy - check the compensation packages.


More info


There's lots of additional resources in



  • GitHub / WeAreHiring / README.md

  • GitHub / WeAreHiring / additional-info/

  • GitHub / WeAreHiring / open-positions/


Contact


Contact person: Travis Byrd, Head of Talent at HotelQuickly. Email: travis.byrd@hotelquickly.com

description:
Abbott is a global healthcare company devoted to improving life through the development of products and technologies that span the breadth of healthcare. With a portfolio of leading, science-based offerings in diagnostics, medical devices, nutritionals and branded generic pharmaceuticals, Abbott serves people in more than 150 countries and employs approximately 73,000 people. Please note that candidates need to be eligible to work in the U.S. without Abbott sponsorship.

JOB DESCRIPTION:

Summary

Abbott is seeking a Systems Integration Engineer to support on-going Research & Development (R&D) efforts. The successful candidate shall possess direct experience in integrating and testing of medical devices.

Primary Job Function

The successful candidate shall apply a wide range of multidisciplinary professional engineering concepts and principles to effectively integrate and test complex medical instrumentation. Responsibilities include:
* Develop test plans and test procedures for components at the unit, subsystem, and system levels
* Troubleshoot and debug mechanical, electrical, and software problems
* Identify design improvements
* Gather and analyze data to establish system requirements
* Demonstrate abilities to follow protocols and workflow instructions

Qualifications:

Outstanding verbal, written, and documentation skills are required.

Excellent collaboration and interpersonal skills to work well with scientists and engineers having widely divergent backgrounds

Instrument programming and scripting in Python

Familiarity with JIRA or similar defect tracking tool

Minimum Education

Bachelors degree in an Engineering or closely related discipline

Minimum Experience/Training

Minimum 3 years of relevant systems integration experience.

Minimum 7 years of relevant experience for Senior level consideration

Experience in a complex medical device experience required and IVD/Hematology experience preferred.

JOB FAMILY:

Engineering-General

DIVISION:

ADD Diagnostics

LOCATION:

United States - California - Santa Clara

ADDITIONAL LOCATIONS:

WORK SHIFT:

Standard

TRAVEL:

No

MEDICAL SURVEILLANCE:

No

SIGNIFICANT WORK ACTIVITIES:

Continuous sitting for prolonged periods (more than 2 consecutive hours in an 8 hour day)
