description:
Vancouver, BC or Santiago


To build amazing software, you need to be where the software lives. That’s the philosophy behind ZenHub, the only project management tool integrated natively in GitHub.


At ZenHub, every team member is charged with getting to know customers deeply, learning how to solve their toughest problems, and turning them into evangelists. Our customers are smart cookies: some of the best teams at Imgur, NASA, Docker, and VMware use ZenHub to stay in the zone.


Should you join ZenHub, your team-members will be world class. We have built two of the world’s most sophisticated browser extensions (on Chrome and Firefox). We ship often and move rapidly, providing more than enough freedom to make your own mistakes and breakthroughs. We have a great code review culture to share knowledge. And we use the right tools for the job: ZenHub’s current stack includes Node, Backbone, Virtual DOM, MongoDB, Redis and RabbitMQ.





Position Description


ZenHub is a best practices-driven engineering team committed to continuous deployment, continuous integration, and automated testing. We’re looking for talented, startup-minded backend engineers to power our growing team in Vancouver, BC or Santiago, Chile.


The ideal candidate will have deep knowledge of web and mobile technology, software design patterns, and best practices – and an obsession with crafting user-centric products that set new standards in usability and performance.


About You



  • Experience shipping high-quality code in a mission-critical environment

  • Demonstrated interest in working with new technologies and thinking outside the box

  • Burning desire to be the “gatekeeper” for ZenHub’s backend architecture, prioritizing performance and scalability

  • Strong grasp of CS fundamentals, algorithms, data structures, and design patterns

  • Commitment to best practices in software development including TDD, continuous integration, Agile, and continuous delivery

  • BS/MS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, or equivalent experience


Bonus Points:



  • Expertise with Node.js and/or Go

  • Experience with Functional Programming and Functional Reactive Programming

  • Prior experience with top-tier, rapid-growth startups

  • Familiarity and comfort with git and GitHub

  • Knowledge/experience with Redis, MongoDB and Express


How to apply


To apply, send an email to zenhub+engineer-s@apply.talera.io and include anything that will help you stand out – your resume, links to GitHub, or recent side projects. Also, briefly (>50 words) tell us about the most impressive thing you have built or achieved.


About Us


ZenHub is a development workflow that moves as fast as your team. Through a lightweight extension, it adds a collection of collaboration-enhancing features – like Epics, Task Boards, Burndown Charts, personal task management, and more – directly into GitHub’s UI, creating a single source of truth for the entire company.


With ZenHub, software teams can focus on what they do best: shipping amazing products.


Salary and Benefits


Competitive salary plus bonus, top-tier benefits, and generous stock / equity.


We provide exceptional benefits:



  • Expanded Insurance. Axiom Zen provides full health, life and AD&D insurance as well as premium vision, dental, and extended health benefits.

  • Active Professional Development. We actively participate in the development of our team. You have access to a Professional Development budget of $1200 per quarter allocated, separate from your compensation, to be spent on conferences, classes, books, and any other resources to maintain and expand your skill set, industry knowledge, and professional growth. Or take someone interesting to coffee for in-person learning.

  • Speaker Travel Budget. We believe strongly that all our team members should have the opportunity to become thought leaders in their fields. To support this, we have a standard policy to cover travel + accommodations for speaking engagements anywhere in the Americas, and are very willing to support speaking engagements elsewhere around the world as well.

  • Mandatory 15 Off Days Per Year and Flexible Remote Work Policy. We have a high standard for impact but we insist on work-life harmony and believe in balance. Minimum of 15 off days every year, with no hard limit.

  • “Live the Brand” Products. We also believe that using great products helps us build them better. Every team member receives a generous equipment budget to try new gadgets, tools, platforms, and products. This includes new wearables, internet-of-things gadgets, etc.

  • “Live the Brand” Experiences. Several times per week, the team engages in fun and exciting products & experiences sponsored by the company. Everyone has the opportunity to submit ideas. We believe time outside of the office helps us think outside the box.

  • Top-Line Equipment. Apple laptop, large 2nd monitor, personal gadget budget, company smartphone of your choice in addition to fully paid voice and data plan. Models dependent upon needs and department function.

  • Maternity / Paternity Leave. Flexible leave in addition to existing leave allowance in accordance with state and federal laws.

  • Transport Reimbursement. We cover public transport to work and back. If you bike to work instead, we set aside $1000/year for bike maintenance. If you walk to work, we’ll bonus you the same amount as a rental subsidy.

  • Quarterly Alignment Check-ins. You will receive quarterly ‘alignment’ check-ins focused on making sure you are achieving your own goals.

description:
FRONT END AT MICROSOFT


In a world where Mobile computing is not a device but a state of mind. It’s a seamless experience across multiple devices where we not only do more, but do it more efficiently. As we touch the glass plane separating us from the internet we actually become a part of it and on our journey we yearn for functionality, simplicity, consistency, and beauty. Come and: 



  • Build…

  • Work with a latest technology.

  • Build the window to the world. We believe computing holds the potential to shape how billions of people live their lives. We each hold within us the potential to shape the future of computing. Potential is just that, potential, until it is put into a plan of action, obsessed over, worked, refined and reworked again and again until it all comes together in a brilliant work of passion sparking a change in the world. At Microsoft we search relentlessly for the limit of potential in people and computing, but haven't found it yet. Microsoft, where the potential to empower billions is unleashed and pursued!


TECHNICAL FOCUS AREAS



  • Web Applications



  • Human Computer Interfaces



  • Thin Client Applications



  • Smart Client Applications


CORE SKILLS


Web Applications



  • Experience developing the UI for a Web Browser.

  • Experience with cross-platform compatibility.


Human Computer Interfaces



  • Experience writing applications for the way users interact with computing devices such as digital eyewear.

  • Experience could be visual based, audio based, keyboard input based, or touch based.


Thin Client Applications



  • Experience with terminal services such as keyboard and screen, remote desktop services or virtual machines.

description:
The Association of Universities for Research in Astronomy, Inc. (AURA) operates several observatory centers (including the National Optical Astronomy Observatory, the National Solar Observatory, Large Synoptic Survey Telescope and the Gemini Observatory) in the United States and Chile under cooperative agreements with the National Science Foundation.
Gemini South is based in La Serena, Chile has an immediate opening for a Real Time Software Engineer. The successful applicant will design and implement new software for the operation of the Gemini Observatory. Support and maintain existing, installed software for the optimum performance of the telescopes and instruments.

Duties and Responsibilities:

1. Provide daytime and night-time operational support by troubleshooting, diagnosing and solving problems with installed software systems.
2. Design and develop software for telescope systems, in collaboration with other groups including Science, Information Systems and the rest of the Engineering team.
3. Follow a rigorous software development life cycle, including all phases: requirements gathering, design, documentation, development, testing, deployment, production and disposal.
4. Assist during commissioning, integration, and testing of new instruments in collaboration with external instrument building teams.
5. Collaborate with engineers from other disciplines as well as the science staff to gather and document requirements for new software systems and improvements to existing systems.
6. Prepare and provide technical documentation for software subsystems (for example, software interface control documents and user manuals).
7. Assume technical ownership and future development, for one or more software systems applying the software development cycles employed at the Observatory.
8. Perform as primary point of contact for software operations support, as needed.

Job Specifications:

This position requires the ability to design, develop and maintain software systems. The successful applicant will be proficient at technical analysis incorporating multiple interacting systems, often drawing on information and experience from other disciplines. Requires excellent verbal and written skills in order to create software requirements, document/implement software changes, and work within a dynamic team environment.

description:
Provide technical leadership and expertise in the field of control system software for large astronomical telescopes and instrumentation. Provide control system solutions that support the needs of the observatory. Support and maintain existing, installed software for the optimum performance of the telescopes and instruments. Actively participate in training and technical leadership for software engineers, new hires and summer interns.  


 Duties and Responsibilities :



  1. Provide daytime and night-time operational support by troubleshooting, diagnosing and solving problems with installed control systems.

  2. Develop conceptual / detailed control system designs that integrate with existing telescope systems.

  3. Develop, maintain and configure high and low level control system software to operate and calibrate high performance, custom designed telescope systems.

  4. Develop and maintain high level Adaptive Optics software tools and wave front sensor correction algorithms.

  5. Develop and maintain system models, diagnostics and support utilities.

  6. Follow a rigorous software development life cycle, including all phases: requirements gathering, design, documentation, development, testing, deployment, production and disposal.

  7. Collaborate with engineers from other disciplines as well as the science staff to gather and document requirements for new software systems and improvements to existing systems.  

  8. Participate in planning, documentation, and tracking of software development projects and processes.

  9. Assume technical ownership and future development, for one or more software systems applying the software development cycles employed at the Observatory.

  10. Provide clearly written documentation, both technical and user-oriented, including software interface control documents, user manuals and operational procedures.

  11. Review software designs done by external contractors and participate in the integration, testing and commissioning phases of new hardware and software systems.

  12. Provide technical leadership and mentoring of software engineers, supervising their work and giving direction as needed.

  13. Research new technologies and investigate ways in which they may be applied to solve problems faced by the observatory. Write proposal documents and whitepapers that explain software systems in a language that can be appreciated by an educated but non-expert audience.

  14. Perform other duties as assigned.


Job Specifications: 


The position requires the ability to support existing tools and utilities used in the control of Observatory systems, including the cutting edge Multi Conjugate Adaptive Optics (MCAO) system.  This position will also participate in development of the next generation of Observatory systems and tools. While the primary role is focused on motion control software, wavefront sensor correction algorithms, and high level adaptive optics software, the candidate is also expected to work with other systems as well. The ideal candidate will be a senior level C developer with an in-depth understanding of the EPICS framework. Experience with Java, Python and other programming languages is also a plus. He/she must be able to work as part of a team (i.e. able to collaborate constructively with other developers, participate in peer reviews, etc.) and also be able to work independently. We are always looking to improve our processes and prefer engineers that are eager to contribute in this area. We develop software using VxWorks/RTEMS and Linux using the EPICS control system framework.  Our target platforms include VME-based Motorola CPUs and Linux-based soft IOCs.

description:
Hopper is a travel startup based in Cambridge, MA and Montreal, QC.

We combine insightful research on massive data sets with intuitive design to help travellers make informed decisions about air travel.

We launched the Hopper app (iOS) at the end of January 2015. Since then, the app has been featured in outlets such as Mashable, TIME, Travel + Leisure, and Buzzfeed. In February, Apple featured Hopper in the App Store ("best new apps").

As a Software Engineer you'll work directly with Product Designers, other Developers and the CTO. You'll be part of a small team with big ambitions: delivering a delightful and powerful product that empowers travellers. We are a versatile full-stack development team. Were always looking for smart, adaptable engineers to help us build great things throughout our stack, which includes:

  • Mobile application development for iOS (Objective-C and Swift) and Android (Java).
  • Middle tier APIs, processing pipelines (Kafka, Storm, Spark) & web services (Finagle) in Scala.
  • Analytics on big data sets (trillions of rows) using Spark (Scala and Python), Hive and Hadoop.
  • Internal web applications using Play (Scala) and Javascript (AngularJS).
  • Development Operations (DevOps) for all of the above, using Mesos, Marathon and Ansible.

What youll do:

  • Write beautiful code: well designed, testable, efficient and maintainable.
  • Learn new languages, technologies and frameworks from one project to the next.
  • Work on a problem from design through to deployment and operations.
  • Collaborate with everyone in the company to solve tough technical and product problems.

***Please note: We are hiring for this position in both Montreal and Cambridge, this application is specifically for the Cambridge-based position. If you are applying for the position in Montreal, please click 'All Jobs' at the top of this page and select the Montreal opening.


Benefits


Compensation will be competitive including equity in an early stage startup backed by top-tier VCs (Atlas Venture, Brightspark and OMERS Ventures).

All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.

description:
We are seeking a high proficient and motivated Senior Database Administrator to join the Database Administration Team (DBA Team), part of the systems Applications team. The European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) offers a unique opportunity to acquire professional experience in an international scientific environment.

The Systems Applications team consists of 15 System Administrators responsible for our virtual infrastructure, database administration and desktop user support.

The DBA team is responsible for the database administration and management of the large central database environment that is deployed over a Virtual Infrastructure based on VMWare. This infrastructure serves most Services and Research groups at EMBL-EBI and incorporates databases across geographically distributed production, public-facing and disaster recovery datacentres.

The Senior Database Administrator job consists of Database Administration and Database Engineering activities, with the latter including Database Design and Software Development aimed at assisting the EMBL-EBI services teams that make use of database backends to implement functionality using a variety of technologies.

The job will include, in the long run, to provide day-to-day Database Administration activities for the Production, Development and Test database environments across the supported database technologies MySQL, Oracle, PostgreSQL, Vertica, Mongo DB and MS SQL Server, and during the first year the successful applicant will work closely with the Database Engineering function in activities that may include:




  • Database design;


  • Advising teams on database technology choice;


  • Implementing existing database applications using different technology;


  • Developing application functionality at the data access tier;


  • Performing data migrations


  • Take part in daily scrum and paired development.



 The activities of the Database Administration Team include (but are not limited to):




  • Database software installation and configuration;


  • Back-up and recovery;


  • Dataguard and replication solutions;


  • Scripting;


  • Performance tuning;


  • Database virtualisation and databases in virtualised environments;


  • Exploring innovation;


  • Monitoring, reporting and keeping online documentation up-to-date;


  • Interacting with database developers and application developers from the EMBL-EBI service teams; and


  • Communicating technical documents.

description:
If you enjoy being a part of the entire software development lifecycle; from design to deployment, ensuring the highest code quality and performance at every step, then you’ll love what we have here at Klarna.


We're growing our test engineering teams here at Klarna; building test automation infrastructure to increase test coverage and improve code quality across our entire engineering organisation.


Some of the stuff you’ll do;



  • Build test automation frameworks that enable development teams to deliver high quality software at speed.

  • Improve the quality and health of Klarna's systems by providing information on how their services are perceived from the outside (using both blackbox and whitebox testing).

  • Devise testing strategies for new business features.

  • Advise development teams on software design choices.

  • Act as a technical ambassador for quality throughout the entire engineering organisation.


Realistically, you’ll need experience building test automation tools and frameworks, as well as a strong coding ability; While we mainly use Ruby, we're searching for problem solvers that are confident working with different technologies and willing to learn new skills. You’ll need to know about contract-driven testing, context-driven testing, agile methodologies (pairing, TDD, BDD) and continuous delivery practices.


You'll work in our knowledge sharing culture, receive a generous occupational pension, 30 days paid annual leave, subsidised gym membership and a range of discounts on everything from electrical goods to flights and hotels.


Interested in finding out more?


Send over your CV and let's arrange a chat.

About us


Here at Klarna we’re simplifying buying - We do this by letting the consumer buy online without signing up for anything, they pay after receiving the goods; we assume the credit and fraud risks for the merchants.


We have more than 1200 employees and we’re active in 18 countries. We serve 35 million consumers and work with 50,000 merchants, processing over 400,000 transactions every day.

description:
Req ID: 122968

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. Our employees live our vision, core values & guiding principles. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.

Software Development Engineer

On top of the solid base of Ericsson’s TV & Media portfolio, delighting over 19 million TV subscribers worldwide, our software development team in Dublin is tasked with building Ericsson’s ground breaking next generation television platform called MediaFirst. And the good news is that we are now fully in growth mode and hiring!

We are looking for top class software engineers to build an exciting new product, based on the latest cloud technologies and development processes and using the best of Agile and Continuous Integration.

This is a great opportunity to be empowered to make a real difference creating a challenging, fun product and being part of a leading edge software development team with strong ties to Silicon Valley through our office in Santa Clara.

The team in Dublin is responsible for building innovative features that take TV & Media to the next level, with media discovery and playback on any device, anywhere, at any time scaling to 100’s of millions of users, with extreme reliability and stability.

Key responsibilities include:  Specification, architecture, design, development, testing and integration of our cloud based next generation IP television platform, with a range of client devices including browsers, tablets, phones, smart TVs and embedded STBs.

Required for the role:

  • Computer science degree or degree in a related area

  • Ability to work both independently and within a team

  • Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Excellent influencing skills.

  • Passion for quality

  • Experience in one or more of these 3 areas:

    • Web technologies:

      • JavaScript/HTML5/CSS

      • Client frameworks such as react, backbone, AngularJS, Nightwatch

    • Server side development:

      • Object oriented development using C# (preferred) or similar languages

      • Passionate about writing top quality code and automated tests to protect this code

      • Building massively scalable web services

      • Familiarity with cloud technologies

    • Embedded client development:

      • Linux, C, C++, JS

      • Platform adaption layers

      • Android, IOS or embedded STB experience

Preferred Experience for the role:

  • Big data analytics platforms such as Hadoop / ElasticSearch / Kibana

  • Continuous Integration tooling and automation processes

  • Affinity with Media & Video. Experience with DVB and/or IPTV client or server products

  • Passion for distributed system architecture

  • Test driven development. Designing and developing unit, component and functional tests and test infrastructure

  • Experience in Windows Azure, AWS or alternative cloud platforms

  • Experience in agile development e.g. Scrum

  • Experience in working across disciplines and geographical borders


*LI-NM5

Ericsson provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetics.

Ericsson complies with applicable country, state and all local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location across the world in which the company has facilities. In addition, Ericsson supports the UN Guiding Principles for Business and Human Rights and the United Nations Global Compact.

This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation, training and development.

Ericsson expressly prohibits any form of workplace harassment based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, pregnancy, parental status, national origin, ethnic background, age, disability, political opinion, social status, veteran status, union membership or genetic information.

description:
Sometimes, we end up in situations that we never planned to be in. We work on products we would never need or use. We get comfortable, settle, and after we blink...years go by.


We get it.


We don’t think that people should be *stuck* in positions like that. So we’re here to ask you a few questions:



  • Do you wake up and get excited about what you’re building and who you’re building it with?

  • Do you impact your company’s products? Process? Culture?

  • Do you work on things YOU think matter?



If not, we would love to meet you.


Who We Are & Why We Exist


We are TrainHeroic. Our goal is to help millions of coaches and athletes find the best versions of themselves. We wake up everyday chasing goals and helping people achieve theirs.


We Believe



  • The pursuit of mastery is the path to meaning and happiness

  • Getting a little bit better everyday is more important than being great

  • Change should be embraced, evolution is inevitable, and innovation is essential

  • Product culture should be centered around exceptional people and project autonomy


We believe those things.


What We Build


TrainHeroic provides the complete web, mobile and tablet solutions for enabling smart and effective strength & conditioning. TrainHeroic’s products serve a broad range of clients across the NBA, NCAA, High School Team Sports, US Olympic Teams, and Functional Fitness/CrossFit communities.


TrainHeroic along with TrainingPeaks, and MakeMusic, are under the umbrella company Peaksware, Inc. We’re located in beautiful Boulder, Colorado and have been recognized as one of Outside Magazine's "Best Places to Work" five years in a row.


We’re looking for a Full-Stack Senior Software Engineer to take over and lead the development of our Athlete applications (web, mobile, and tablet).  


We are seeking engineers who can help us scale our products to handle complex and varied usage environments (gym, home, off-line, low light, high noise etc.), implement intuitive and delightful UI’s, and ensure our growing data set is lighting fast to consume.


We need full-stack engineers who are forward thinking and excited to tackle new functionality like:



  • 3rd Party Device integrations (wearables, video, etc.)

  • Expanded social functionality (in-app results sharing and comparing) to drive athlete engagement

  • Immediate feedback features powered by Big Data


We believe in creating reliable, fast products. As we grow our user base from 100k users past 1M+, we need thoughtful, strategic technical solutions.


Responsibilities



  • Create and improve features across technologies for web, mobile, tablet (AngularJS, Ionic, HTML5)

  • Improve our RESTful api response times (PHP, MySQL, etc.)

  • Evaluate developmental trade offs and know when to push on one side or the other

  • Be comfortable suggesting and implementing various DevOps initiatives, AWS (CloudFront, BeanStalk, EC2, RDS, etc.)


All Employees Receive



  • Competitive compensation and incentives

  • 100% company paid medical plan for employees with buy-up options as well as dental and vision insurance for employees (dependent coverage available)

  • $1,200/yr fitness reimbursement for gym related purchases

  • 15 Days of PTO for all new hires…increases in PTO at various years of service/experience

  • After 7 years of service we offer a four week paid sabbatical for all employees

  • Fully stocked kitchen with snacks, drinks and endless caffeine

  • On-site workout area access: full weight lifting gym with CrossFit equipment, treadmill, bike trainers, and changing rooms, showers and towel service

  • Join us in our new beautiful satellite office in the hottest neighborhood in Denver

description:
Like pizza? Help us build the software restaurant companies use to deliver 2 million pizzas every week.


The Opportunity


We are seeking outstanding Software Developers to help tackle the exciting technical opportunities ahead.  You will be joining a great team that develops SpeedLine’s cloud-enabled platform.  Your areas of responsibility range from data modeling, business logic, distributed processing to service messaging, system insights, and data diagnostics.  This is an opportunity to develop high-profile elements of SpeedLine’s architecture, build systems at scale, and deliver business-impacting projects.  You will shape the future of our product and industry.

description:
About Audible:

Audible, Inc. is the world’s largest seller and producer of spoken audio entertainment, information and educational programming. Since inventing and commercializing the first portable digital audio player in 1997, our focus on technological innovation and superior programming has earned us millions of subscribers around the world. We’re an Amazon subsidiary with a presence on three different continents, yet we maintain a startup vibe and small company feel. We offer more than 250,000 downloadable audiobooks, audio editions of periodicals, and other programs, and an escalating array of listening products that enrich daily life for a growing population of people who want to be more productive, well-informed, and thoughtfully entertained



About the Team:

Audible for Windows 10 universal app is one of the best rated app in Windows 10 store. Our app works on any Windows 10 device: phone, tablet, Surface, 2-in-1, desktop, laptop and soon on Xbox too. We have small but very agile and innovative Windows 10 team at Audible obsessed with bringing the best Audible experience to Windows 10 platform.



About the Role:

We are looking for a back end services and web developer to support our Audible for Windows 10 application initiatives and functionality. The person will develop web services and apis consumed by our Windows 10 app and web mobile store features rendered in the app to support various application initiatives.



The candidate will interface with existing Audible platform services team and mobile store team. He or she must be very agile, innovative, ready to work in rapid development and deployment environment with short development and release cycles, work both independently and as part of the team, handle multiple dependencies, take pride in the work done and be obsessed with customer satisfaction.



Responsibilities:


  • Design, develop, debug high quality scalable services typically in Java

  • Build and deploy solutions for problems of size-able scope, scale and complexity

  • Support day-to-day functional maintenance of the web-based services that your team owns

  • Preparation of technical requirements, software design specifications and other forms of documentation

  • Collaborate with other Software Development Engineers in code-reviews and debugging issues

  • Communicate effectively with all team members to ensure development projects meet or exceed performance targets

  • Deliver first-class work on tight schedules





Qualifications: 




  • BS/or MS in Computer Science or equivalent with 5+ years of industry experience

  • Excellent object oriented analysis and design skills (OOA/OOD)

  • Web based application framework - Java (J2EE Tomcat Servlet container model Spring, Hibernate) or C++

  • Familiarity with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript

  • Expertise in UNIX

  • Able to thrive in an ambiguous environment - where change is the only constant

  • Self-motivated, accountable, and having a sense of ownership; take pride in what you code

  • Strong knowledge of data structures, algorithms, and designing for performance, scalability, and availability

  • Experience building scalable software or distributed systems

  • Experience working with relational databases (Oracle and JDBC/Hibernate a plus)



Preferred Qualifications: 




  • Knowledge of build systems such ANT & Maven

  • Prior experience in building service oriented (SOA) distributed systems in a high volume environment

  • Understanding of web services technologies such as SOAP, HTTP, WSDL, XSD, and REST

  • Familiarity with frameworks such as Spring and Hibernate.

  • Understanding of system and application performance limits and characteristics





Benefits:    

We have a comprehensive benefits package but here are some of the fun perks:




  • Free catered lunch daily, breakfast on Mondays, all the snacks you can eat and Happy Hour on a Friday

  • Tuition assistance

  • Access to Amazon Web Services and much more...

Perferred Qualifications

description:
Hei! Etsin duunikaverikseni kehittäjää, joka on ylpeä tuottamastaan koodista ja välittää lopputuloksesta.



Meillä Wunderdogilla pyritään tarjoamaan tekijöille käyttöön moderneja teknologioita ja kokeilemme ratkaisuissa uusia työkaluja. Esimerkiksi tänä vuonna meillä on jo alkanut 2-3 React- ja React Native -projektia ja myyjämme haalivat jatkuvasti lisää. Funktionaaliset kielet ovat suosiossamme, mutta yleisimpiä käytettyjä kieliä projekteissa ovat JavaScript, Java, Scala, Clojure, Python ja Ruby. Ammattitaidon lisäksi työkavereissani arvostan omia mielipiteitä, kriittisyyttä, rehellisyyttä, joustavuutta ja omistautuneisuutta.


Takaan, että Wunderdogilla tulet kehittymään sekä ohjelmoijana että ihmisenä. Vaikka työ tehdään pääasiassa asiakkaan kanssa heidän tiloissaan, vietämme jokaisen perjantain yhdessä omalla toimistollamme Wufficella Helsingin ydinkeskustassa. Pidämme yrityksemme tiedot täysin avoimina työntekijöille ja jaamme vastuuta tasaisesti kaikkien kesken. Yhdessä ideoimme yrityksen kehityssuuntaa ja luomme työpaikkaa, jossa on hyvä meininki. Arvostamme ammattiosaamisen kehittämistä ja tiedon jakamista: pidämme toimistollamme lähes viikottain tekkisessioita, joissa käymme läpi uusia teknologioita, toteutuneita ratkaisuja ja menetelmiä. Viimeaikaisia teemoja ovat olleet esimerkiksi Haskell, Elm, UX ja palvelumuotoilu.


Tuntuuko, että viihtyisit meillä? Tule juttelemaan lisää kanssamme.
Lähetä CV ja hakemuksesi 30.05.2016 mennessä Stack Overflow:n kautta tai sähköpostitse osoitteeseen rekrytointi(at)wunder.dog. Wunderdogin tunnelmia voit seurata Facebookissa, Instagramissa ja Twitterissä.


Terveisin,
Timo Sand (guve)
Senior Software Developer

description:
As a software engineer in analytics team at Celtra, you will build, maintain and improve all parts of our data processing pipeline, processing 2B+ analytics events per day, producing insights used by top brands, publishers and agencies.


Tech stack


Our backend consists of Scala and PHP backend services, REST API and ad serving, Scala/Spark (for processing the data and S3/MySQL/Snowflake for storing the data at different stages in the processing lifecycle. We use Spark Standalone in production and Databricks for exploratory data analysis. We’re constantly re-evaluating our technical infrastructure to deliver faster, better, and more reliable software.


What we’re looking for:


You care about proper engineering and clean code. You write consistently high-quality, maintainable code and are aware of industry best practices and trends. You proactively identify and clean up technical debt before it turns into a long-term problem and encourage others to do the same.


Your code runs in production somewhere. You have production experience with some of the parts of our stack: AWS, Spark/Akka, Scala, MySQL, DynamoDB, Snowflake, etc. and for the parts you don’t, you are excited to learn.


You have something to teach us. You have had exposure to other big data technologies that we do not use in production. Whether it be streaming solutions (Kinesis, Kafka, Storm, Samza) or storage/databases (Vertica, Teradata, Redshift, BigQuery), we go by saying: “Be conservative in what you use, be liberal in what you learn.”


You own what you do. You have owned larger parts of codebase before and have had the phone ring on you because something went wrong.

description:
About Us:


Braintree builds products that make payments easier—so easy that they fade into the background, making entirely new kinds of interactions possible. The Braintree full-stack payment platform lets companies build their own experiences and then scale their businesses around the globe. We're known for our technology but we're also known for our support, with internal risk and underwriting, account management and technical support teams who ensure a frictionless payments experience.

Our technology fuels companies like GitHub, 37Signals, Uber, Airbnb, OpenTable, Heroku and more.


Recently acquired by PayPal, Braintree is now in an even greater position to change the way people pay. The team recently launched v.zero, a new SDK that enables processing of all payment instruments and platforms in a single code path. Headquartered in Chicago, Braintree has offices in San Francisco, New York, Sydney, London with employees stationed around the world. 

Check us out - Braintree on The Muse: http://muse.cm/1wWa28H


Senior Software Engineer:

We’re looking for Software Engineers to join the squad and help us continue building solutions to complex problems and innovate in the space. Here is a little info on our team:


We are polyglots... 

Although most of our software is written in Ruby, we don’t confine ourselves to a single programming language. We believe in using the best tool for the job while maintaining a slight bias toward the tools the team knows the best. We’ve written infrastructure components in Python, and we build client libraries for integrating with Braintree in Ruby, Python, Node.js, PHP, Java, and .NET.


We pair program…


We work on Macbook Pros with two keyboards and dual 27" cinema displays. We work in an open team room; no cubicles or private offices. Communication is key to our process, and we don't want to hinder it with walls. 

We test... 

Testing is at the forefront of our development philosophy. We never need to check our code coverage to know that it's at 100%: with disciplined TDD, no line of code will be written without a test. We're confident that our automated testing is thorough and will catch any regression bugs - and that’s critical given the software we write! We use continuous integration to test every version of every client library against our gateway.


We are agile...


Agile development methodologies mean different things to different people. For us, the most important part of Agile is doing what works best for the team. We have a story card wall and release a few times a week. We keep the team in sync with daily stand-ups and have a retrospective once a month to discuss things that are going well and opportunities for improvements. We’re pragmatic, not dogmatic. Although we have strong opinions, we're never afraid to try to new things to see if they work and reconsider our positions if the situation warrants it. 

We value our people... 

-Two paid conferences annually to everyone on the Products Team


-Open Dev Day twice a month 


-Catered lunches daily


-Commuter reimbursement program


Take a look at some of our blog posts and scope our code on GitHub


Braintrust

Braintree GitHub

A million people a year die in car collisions around the world. That number should be zero. You can help us create a new insurance company that uses the latest technology and data science methods to save lives by preventing car collisions before they happen. As an early-stage developer you will have a lot of input about the development and growth of the code base. You will build the critical backend systems and services for the website and mobile app that are the core of the business. Your team members will also be world class experts and will respect you for your deep experience, commanding technical knowledge, and selflessness. description:
Full Stack Software Engineer - Ruby, .NET

The strength of our solutions and brand combined with your expertise empower us to literally change peoples' lives!

Who We Are:

This is an exciting time at CareerBuilder as we continue the rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation. Fueled by technology that is years ahead of the competition, we're doing something the industry has never seen before: unifying the recruiter experience in one pre-hire platform that is always on, is data-driven and is easy to use. You'll see us expand into more markets with innovative products and services that are changing the way companies recruit new talent around the world. As a Software Engineer at CareerBuilder, you'll have the opportunity to do something extraordinary. Our employees are what drive our success and are at the very core of our identity.

About the Job Discovery Team
  • We are passionate about making the process of finding the right job simple and effective
  • We realize that our work is often the first way millions of users engage with CareerBuilder and our clients and that our work will help many of them get hired
  • We believe that the job is never done and that the needs of our users are always changing, especially as technology changes. This will always allow us to reexamine and refine our work so that waste is eliminated and the users' experience is enhanced


We are committed to helping job seekers easily and quickly find the right job. The core objective of the millions of visitors to our site is to be hired at one of our job openings. To be hired at an opening a job seeker needs to apply, and before a job seeker is going to apply to an opening they have to find the right opening. On the job discovery team we know that we are the first step in a seeker reaching their goal.

Who You Are:

Are you a Software Engineer with a passion for Ruby on Rails development? Are you an expert in object oriented programming with a strong desire to learn Ruby on Rails?

The Job Discovery Team at CareerBuilder is looking for a passionate and experienced Software Engineer to join our team. We work in a large-scale, challenging, fast-paced environment that only a handful of other companies operate at. In this role, you will help us deliver amazing products that allow our users to find the job of their dreams.
  • As a software engineer you will help us better engage our consumers by developing web applications, APIs, and backends for the CareerBuilder site which supports millions of unique visitors per day
  • As a software engineer you will work with a variety of cloud and open source technologies to help build and inspire the architecture of the future
  • Our coding philosophies align with SOLID principles and Clean Code embodies our culture
  • We practice dual-track agile development; we actively engage with and listen to our users to build a solution that offers the tools they need and removes the ones they don't

description:
We need super smart engineers from all levels to help us build one of the best engineered e-commerce platform in the world (big talk we know, but that is our goal!). Our engineers combine creativity, curiosity, and drive to continuously perfect and revolutionize Jet from the inside out. We are looking to bring more intellectually curious engineers who are passionate about technology in general (Jet is a technology first company and prides itself on its culture of learning and knowledge sharing and we want all our engineers to be as passionate as we are!) 


The Environment


Our platform is largely an event driven platform implemented via a microservice architecture. The platform runs on Microsoft Azure and uses a large number of technologies and middle ware. The bulk of backend code is written in a functional style (F#) and our system of record is an event sourced system (essentially a log of all actions on the platform). We use a mix of Kafka, Redis, Elastic Search, Azure SQL, Event Store and Azure Storage for our data stores. About 50% of the platform runs on Linux and the rest Windows (although we move into more containerization we will see a shift towards Linux).


The Job


We are looking for talented Software Engineers who are passionate about improving the state of Software Engineering. This role impacts all of our engineering team and will help improve speed of development and quality of product. Responsibilities will include: Identify and develop technologies/tools which can drive improvements in efficiency of our system; recognize potential risk factors on our website; Performance, integration and chaos engineering; provide best practices to the engineering teams. Our software is quickly evolving and used by millions, this role will be dynamic, challenging, and critical to our success.



  • Identify and develop technologies/tools to improve the efficiency of our system.

  • Risk assessment: help determine functionality that have the biggest productivity impact on the site.

  • Performance/Integration/Chaos Engineering.

  • Provide best practices to the engineering teams.


The Person



  • Must have good programming skills with OO (preferred experience with functional programming)

  • Knowledge of distributed systems

  • Working knowledge chaos/performance engineering;

  • Working knowledge of continuous integration/continuous deployment process

  • BS or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or related field is preferred

  • Experience with building code static analysis tools


Compensation Philosophy


Our compensation philosophy is simple but powerful. Give everyone a meaningful stake in the company—the purest form of ownership. That’s why on top of base salary, Jet’s comp structure is heavily weighted in equity. Our collective hard work, high performance, and tenure are rewarded as our equity builds in value.


Benefits & Perks


Competitive Salaries.  Real Ownership in the form of Stock Options.  Unlimited Vacation.  Full Healthcare Benefits.  Exceptional Work Environment.  Learning & Development Opportunities.  Just for fun Networking & Events.

description:
Want to have fun coding cool, challenging stuff from the comfort of your own home?

Eager to join a team of high-performing, yet humble systems thinkers that simply get things done?

Ready to be part of something that makes a clear, fast, measurable improvement in peoples lives?

Excited to ride the wave of a rapidly growing $250 billion+ industry thats full of exciting challenges?

If so, wed love you to read on see the exciting things were working on how you can help.

What Youll Be Doing:

  • Primary focus will be adding features and functionality to our direct response software platform (LAMP), integrating with 3rd party tools, optimizing our web infrastructure and creating workflow automation modules.
  • Designing, maintaining and enhancing internal systems, programs and web applications, including e-commerce, marketing campaign tracking, content management and more.
  • Building and improving existing and new analytics and reports using MySQL, large datasets, and a custom-build replication and data warehouse engine.
  • Manage asset, code, and database deployments to managed servers and cloud servers, as well as building or finding tools to improve and automate the deployment and testing process.
  • Proactively suggest ways to improve any system you work with, looking for opportunities to use technology to deliver clear, measurable value to the business.

Who We Are:

We, Natural Health Sherpa (http://naturalhealthsherpa.com), create innovative products that optimize peoples metabolism so they can enjoy more energy, feel great and enjoy life. Frustratingly, the world is setup to encourage sickness vs. health, so our products are designed to make healthy living super-easy.

We're an 8-figure company that's been profitable since day 1 of our founding in 2010. Were in a hyper-growth phase, on track to more than double in 2016. We're riding the $250+ billion annual tidal wave of demand for natural health products. It is an extremely exciting time to be doing what we are doing.

Our nutrition courses and exercise videos are designed to deliver the most results in the least time. For example, our exercise videos deliver the same or better benefits in just 15 minutes, 3 times a week than do traditional exercise programs that require 60 minutes, 5 times a week. Yes, really. You can see an example of one of our exercise products at http://www.metabolicprime.com as our e-commerce happens on product-specific websites.

We also formulate state-of-the-art nutritional supplements and functional foods that provide the nutrients that fuel a healthy metabolism, generating the energy you need to consistently perform at your peak. For example, instead of taking weeks to notice a difference, it takes just days to feel better.

We practice what we preach: our company is designed so everyone on our team both enjoys their work challenges while having plenty of time to do what they love to do the most in their life. We recruit only high-performing, humble people who produce in fast cycles, hold themselves accountable and have fun.


Benefits


What You'll Enjoy from Us:

  • A highly competitive salary that respects the fact that you are a needle in a haystack, a true high-performer that any company would die to have on their team.
  • Negotiable benefits that can be customized to your specific situation, rather than forcing you to accept something that may not make sense for you
  • A fantastic lifestyle that allows you to work from home, have flexible hours when needed with ability to carve out time to do what you love.

Job Description

Dealer Inspire is looking for an experienced developer to join our team.  We're always innovating - we're looking for people that can own projects and see them through to delivery - while we want rock stars, we're not interested in prima donnas.  Personal responsibility with respect to quality, attention to detail, and contribution of ideas is highly needed to succeed.

At Dealer Inspire, we like to look at current problems and 'rethink' about solutions.  We're flexible - we don't write requirements in stone, and things can change regularly.  This means rethinking how the solutions work best.  Do you want to come 'rethink' with us?

Skills & Requirements

We're flexible with learning on the job, with corresponding relevant work experience - but, for this position to be successful we need you to know the following, with a strong self-initiative to learn others!

Required:

  • PHP - framework experience required - we appreciate DRY principles.
  • MySQL
  • HTML/CSS (basic level - not looking for designer level)
  • Basic Linux admin (ability to SSH, view logs, etc)

Optional:

  • Experience with CSV / XML parsing
  • 'Live' API integrations
  • Well architected REST API design

About Dealer Inspire

Dealer Inspire is an automotive website platform provider located in downtown Naperville, Illinois. We pride ourselves in having a fun, unconventional working environment and a great culture. While our team works extremely hard, we try to keep it a fun and creative work environment. We are located in the heart of downtown Naperville, IL, steps from great restaurants and a beautiful river walk.

Compensation:

Compensation based upon skill and previous experience. Motivated and talented individuals may advance quickly in our fast growing company.

Perks:

  • 100% match of your 401k contributions up to 3% of your gross income
  • 10 days paid time off, 5 days of sick/safe leave and selected paid holidays
  • Work time/Fun time bi-monthly team outings
  • Coaching and career building
  • Subsidized gym membership
  • Subsidized internet access for your home
  • Benefits package including Health, Life, Dental, Vision, and Disability

description:
About the role


Our engineering teams architect, develop and test our social network. As a Senior Frontend Developer, you will be responsible for building awesome frontends, assuring their quality and running them in a production environment in an interdisciplinary team of different specialists.



As a Senior Frontend Developer at InterNations, you will:



  • implement and architect web applications in HTML, CSS and JavaScript in a Scrum team

  • identify and communicate front-end best practices

  • build efficient and reusable front-end systems and abstractions

  • test your code with automated tests

  • take part in expanding, documenting and implementing our UX pattern library

  • work with Product Management on the feasibility of upcoming changes



You meet the following requirements:



  • expert-level knowledge of JavaScript: you understand prototypal inheritance, scope, and closures

  • experience beyond ES5 (e.g. ES6, TypeScript, CoffeeScript)

  • expert-level experience in JavaScript frameworks, especially React and Backbone

  • you care about consistency of design and dislike having ten different buttons on a single page

  • everyone hates Internet Explorer - Internet Explorer hates you (and we only need to support IE 10+)

  • you like fast web applications and know how to optimize them

  • you’ve worked with one or multiple template engines

  • you want to learn new things: technology, practices, user interactions

  • you have an interest in coordinating cross-team efforts and initiatives



We offer:



  • top notch MacBook, 27” display, keyboard layout of choice

  • a fast-growing, dynamic company with international scope

  • a friendly work atmosphere and the space you need to pursue your own ideas

  • weekly team breakfasts, fresh fruit & regular team events

  • a central location in a wonderful cosmopolitan city with beautiful natural surroundings

  • support with visa and work permit application



Sound interesting?


Then start the conversation by sending in your application today (CV, cover letter, start date, salary expectation) c/o Lars Strojny to:jobs@internations.org

Please include in your cover letter a list of projects you contributed to and are proud of. We also like to hear about what kind of work environment you aspire for and what technologies you find interesting right now.

Cimpress, the corporate entity of the well-known vistaprint.com, serves many different business units through a very robust technology back-end. Cimpress exhibits both of these traits, and is looking to design and automate our technologies into the future using best practices and the latest products!



As a Software Engineer, II Infrastructure Automation Team working within the Infrastructure Automation Engineering team, you will join a group of other talented DevOps engineers working to automate existing workflows and processes to improve both capacity and capabilities. The ideal candidate will be utilizing their skills to integrate with third-party products via published APIs to provide automation software to programmatically accomplish workflow activities and give our engineers a cohesive, AWS-like experience for consuming infrastructure services.



Encouragement to design and implement using new technologies, existing standards, and best practices sit at the core of this Infrastructure Automation Engineering team. Qualifications

description:
As a DevOps Engineer at Cimpress, you will be responsible for building, operating, and maintaining a variety of systems used by development teams in a microservices environment. This will include source control management systems such as Git, continuous integration platforms such as Jenkins, binary repository management solutions such as Artifactory, logging systems such as Elasticsearch, monitoring/metrics systems such as Sensu and Graphite, and more.


We’re seeking a generalist that is comfortable in the construction & operation of these systems.


In one case, you may troubleshoot problems pushing code to Bitbucket Server from a Ruby script.


In another, you might investigate an issue with Consul nodes disconnecting from the cluster.


In yet another, you might write Terraform configuration to create and control an ECS Docker cluster in AWS.


With a breadth of knowledge spanning all aspects of TechOps, you will be actively involved with the entire lifecycle of microservice and infrastructure architecture, development, and operation - including application development, deployment, monitoring, and maintenance. You will work hand-in-hand with development teams, identify and mitigate problems, and build robust systems with high degrees of reliability, flexibility, scalability, and uptime.


We’re seeking the right kind of operations expert… ... the kind who offers empathetic and comprehensive support and education to development teams.


… the kind who identifies repeatable tasks and automates them.


… the kind who spots scalability concerns in infrastructure and code design and addresses them.


The position is in Cimpress’ Mass Customization Platform organization, and all of the Cimpress brands at large depend on the availability of the solutions we implement. As such, you’ll be part of an on-call rotation for escalation of problems with our most critical systems.


Daily Responsibilities



  • Support and educate development teams in the use of cloud technologies, continuous delivery products and services, and monitoring tools.

  • Identify and implement third-party, open source, or *aaS solutions to development and operational challenges.

  • Design, build, and operate in-house solutions where no existing solution exists (open-sourcing where appropriate).

  • Share knowledge with Wiki articles, READMEs, and in person stand-ups and lightning talks.

  • Promote uptime by working assigned tickets and responding to on-call escalations


Required Abilities


All candidates must have relevant work history of 3+ years in the industry, and be able to demonstrate their knowledge, reliability, and creativity with modern IT infrastructure and cloud technologies. Candidates must embody a strong capability and desire to help others with technology, and must possess strong motivation to build, improve, and maintain the robust IT services needed by a large enterprise.


Required Knowledge/Experience



  •   Administration of corporate servers (Ubuntu/Debian, Windows Server 2008+)

  •   Usage of source control management systems (Git, Subversion)

  •   Authoring in modern scripting languages (Ruby, Bash, Python)

  •   Creation and operation of web applications (Javascript, Java, C#)

  •   Comprehension of underlying IT concepts (DNS, HTTP, SSL, SSH)

  •   Cloud design concepts and automation tools (Terraform, Boto, CloudFormation)

  •   Configuration management tools (Puppet, Chef, Ansible, Salt)


Desired Skills/Knowledge/Experience



  •   Containerization and container orchestration tools (Docker, Kubernetes, ECS)

  •   Infrastructure management tools (Packer, Vagrant, Consul, Terraform)

  •   Logging and monitoring tools (Logstash, Graphite, StatsD, Kibana, Grafana)

  •   Continuous integration systems (Jenkins, TravisCI, TeamCity, Team Foundation Server)

  •   Software web proxies/load balancers (nginx, varnish, haproxy, squid)

  •   Virtualization platforms (VMWare ESX, Virtualbox, OpenStack, KVM)

  •   Database technologies (MS-SQL, Elasticsearch, PostgreSQL, Redis)

description:
Instructure was founded to define, develop, and deploy superior, easy-to-use software. (And that’s what we did / do / will keep on doing.) We are dedicated to the fight against iffy, mothbally, shoddy software. We make better, more usable tools for teaching and learning (you know, stuff people will actually use). A better connected and more open edtech ecosystem. And more effective ways for everyone everywhere to access education, make discoveries, share knowledge, be inspired, and do big things. We accomplish all this by giving smart, creative, passionate people opportunities to create awesome. So here’s your opportunity. We’re hiring engineers who are passionate about technology and education. The product team doesn't throw specs over some imaginary wall to engineering, and engineering doesn't throw code over some imaginary wall to QA. We all collaborate together. Check out our online courses on Canvas Network. So…if you like front-end development, back-end development, or some combination of these, let's talk. There are lots of interesting, complex, and challenging problems that will leverage your skills; oh, and new things come up every day. There will be a technical interview with lots of white board action (but no silly puzzles or trick questions). We may even have you code up a simple app to demonstrate your abilities.

description:
Req ID: 129448

Ericsson Overview

Ericsson is a world-leading provider of telecommunications equipment & services to mobile & fixed network operators. Over 1,000 networks in more than 180 countries use Ericsson equipment, & more than 40 percent of the world's mobile traffic passes through Ericsson networks. Using innovation to empower people, business & society, we are working towards the Networked Society, in which everything that can benefit from a connection will have one. At Ericsson, we apply our innovation to market-based solutions that empower people & society to help shape a more sustainable world.

We are truly a global company, working across borders in 175 countries, offering a diverse, performance-driven culture & an innovative & engaging environment where employees enhance their potential every day. Our employees live our vision, core values & guiding principles. They share a passion to win & a high responsiveness to customer needs that in turn makes us a desirable partner to our clients. To ensure professional growth, Ericsson offers a stimulating work experience, continuous learning & growth opportunities that allow you to acquire the knowledge & skills necessary to reach your career goals.

Job Summary – Solution Architect

Locations:  Piscataway, NJ; Bellevue, WA; Mississauga, Canada

Summary
As an Experienced Solution Architect (SA), you will be responsible for managing customer requirements utilizing Ericsson’s Service Fulfillment portfolio. The SA is engaged with the account team from pre-sales through the implementation and conclusion stages of the project. The SA should be competent in driving the customer in a technical sales and consulting manner, displaying leadership with respect to Ericsson resources as well as third party suppliers and subcontractors, and handling unexpected changes in scope. As an SA you will be placed at the center of activities, entailing a high level of interaction with Regions, Product Units, Systems Integration teams as well as Customer, Technical, Marketing and Business Development teams.

Impact
A Solution Architect Experienced mainly interacts with other Ericsson Services Professionals, groups within the Service Delivery organization, customers, engagement practice teams as well as the customer units.


Key responsibilities include: driving high customer satisfaction, performing add-on sales, ensuring project success end to end, leading and mentoring team members, and constantly innovating.

Main Responsibilities

Based on business needs, responsibilities may include the following:

  • Analyze complex customer business requirements and formulate detailed requirement specifications that serve to enhance customer's competitive position.
  • Provide high-level and detailed consultative solutions and technical sales support for selected customer opportunities.
  • Perform in-depth and high-level technical presentations for customers, partners and potential clients.
  • Select or propose 3rd party suppliers/products for the Customer Solution. Work with and manage customized solutions and products, including 3rd party products.
  • Drive changes in the methods, processes and guidelines within the customer organization or internally.
  • Identify and drive add-on sales and new business opportunities during the process in order to contribute to increased sales volumes.
  • Manage teams of less experienced Solution Architect or Service Engineers in Customer Projects to ensure that they are delivered according to expectations and plans.
  • Act as a leader/mentor in day to day operations to provide insights for less experienced colleagues. Be a bridge between the customer and internal project team members.
  • Understand workflow based software design/testing including catalog-driven workflow.
  • Have experience with designing Product Catalogs (commercial as well as technical catalog), implementing the product life cycle and catalog-driven workflow management.
  • Strong knowledge of the SID model and able to implement Ericsson Product Catalog (commercial as well as technical catalog) with product offerings, product specifications, customer facing services, resource facing services and resources.
  • Being familiar with business interaction implementations of catalog a plus.
  • Have experience with designing workflows via both catalog-driven orchestration and business process management.
  • Design automated workflows that integrate with and coordinate provisioning systems, network inventory systems and other external applications.
  • Design automated workflows to provision and manage residential and enterprise services.
  • Create workflow specifications and escalate issues to Principal Architect as needed.
  • Write technical specifications when required to revise designed workflows/architecture.
  • Have experience with creating Ericsson catalog objects including charges, tariffs and rates.
  • Be recognized as a leader in knowledge sharing communities.
  • Travel internationally and sometimes on short notice with variable durations (up to 30% per year).
  • Participate in technical reviews and provide technical support to our customers, third party partners and Ericsson organizations.

Accountabilities

  • Deliver all services as per the Ericsson Global Processes.
  • Expected to travel Domestically/internationally up to 50% per year and sometimes on short notice with variable durations.
  • Play significant role in improvement initiatives
  • Responsible for continuously keeping your competence and skills up to date
  • Expected to mentor others
  • Opportunities to take on senior roles
  • Actively contributes to knowledge sharing, innovation program and automation effort
  • Active in add-on sales

Recommended Minimum Requirements

Education: Master’s degree in Engineering/Computer Science or equivalent.

Pertinent Experience: Four+ years of relevant experience in a Software or Telecommunications environment where at least 3 of those years are with ConceptWave products as a Solution Architect position, Developer or equivalent.

Competence

  • At least 3 years working experience with ConceptWave (Order Care and Catalog Manager) as a developer, Integrator or Solution Architect.
  • At least 2 years working experience in OSS and BSS domain.
  • Experience with JAVA/J2EE, JavaScript, XML, JDBC, EJB, Web Services, Design Patterns, Struts, JSP, JSON, Servelets, Jboss, ANT, JPA, Hibernate, AJAX, Agile Methodologies, J2ME, Selenium, JUnit, Oracle database, MYSQL.
  • Very good knowledge of operator networks & business environments.
  • Very good knowledge of Wireless and broadband networks.
  • Good knowledge with wireless and/or wireline provisioning
  • Ericsson Multi Activation (EMA/PG), Automatic Device Configuration (ADC), Ericsson remote device management (ERDM) and SF Telcordia portfolio knowledge an asset.

*LI-LB3

NOTE: Equivalence for Minimum Requirements will be considered

description:
Req ID: 121838

 

System Test and Verification Engineer

Ericsson Athlone is responsible for creating the world class software systems which allow mobile operators manage, optimize and analyze their networks. 

The Ericsson Software Campus in Athlone is the OSS (Operator Support System) headquarters within Ericsson globally and the main development centre for OSS and OSS RC Product lines.  The OSS is the global market leader in mobile telecoms network management.  The OSS system is delivered into 320 operators in 150 countries and manages over 1 Billion subscribers.

Here is a video of the Ericsson Software Campus: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZiyVS5_-Eg0

We require test engineers to contribute to the next generation of Ericsson OSS offerings which will significantly reduce cost of ownership and lead-time of features to customer.

Summary:

The successful candidate will work as a full-time member of the Fault Finding team responsible for automated testing of the integration, deployment, roll-out and delivery to the release function of the new OSS solution. This includes installation, upgrade, system test, application failure analysis, and process improvements of the software delivery pipeline. The role will also include use of, and development of, automated tests using Java to verify deployments in a quick and repeatable manner, always ensuring quality.

The candidate will need to have previous and proven experience of integration, roll-out, testing, release and delivery of enterprise solutions. They should have a broad technological understanding covering server hardware, storage, operating systems and IP networks.

Experience with Core Java and knowledge of JBOSS and JEE Application Servers will be an advantage. The candidate will need to engage with many different layers in the business including systems architects, development engineers, scrum masters and customer facing management to ensure that the right solution is being verified and deployed with the right level of quality at all times.

Role Overview:

  • Verification of procedures in a customer like network, install, upgrade, and system test.
  • Integration of platform components and applications
  • Test of OSS application functionality, deployment, availability, robustness, etc.
  • Troubleshooting of issues and taking corrective actions
  • Development and documentation of release, delivery and maintenance track procedures
  • Use, development, and maintenance of automated tools for validation of the system
  • Report on activities to Release/Maintenance management

Qualifications

Competence Requirements

Successful candidates will have:

  • Previous roles and a proven record and in enterprise system roll-out, integration, test and delivery( OSS systems)
  • Knowledge of Redhat Enterprise Linux administration and troubleshooting
  • Hardware (HP blade), storage and networking expertise
  • Telecom Domain knowledge preferable
  • Customer knowledge and on-site experience
  • Knowledge of Java, JEE and JBOSS is a distinct advantage
  • Understanding of SCRUM, Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development
  • Knowledge of tools such as Selenium, Squish, Curl, JMeter, LoadRunner, Jenkins and  JCat
  • Knowledge of virtualization solutions such as libvirt, vmware, openstack.
  • Strong analytical and design skills, excellent planning and problem solving skills
  • Excellent oral and written communications skills
  • Ability to work as part of a team

Education:

BSc degree or comparable experience

description:
Who We Are 

Kira Systems is a Toronto-based startup. Our machine-learning-powered software helps professionals (lawyers, auditors, consultants, businesses) uncover relevant information from contracts. Our customers include some of the world’s largest corporations, law firms, and professional service firms.


Who We Are Looking For


In this role your job will be to:



  • coordinate the development team’s progress towards product goals

  • care about people and help them grow and achieve their goals

  • filter and help prioritize feature and bug requests from our clients and product management team

  • directly interact with our partners and larger clients

  • shepherd our QA process


There is an important development component to this position, but your primary impact will come through enabling others; we expect that you will spend about 50% of your time writing code.


You are interested in working in that sweet spot between the dev team and other stakeholders within and outside of our organization, but you can also write code and manage process in our dev team.  Our dev team has a flat structure and you can guide it while keeping the process light.


Additionally, you



  • have senior programming experience, ideally including some functional programming experience;

  • have worked in a management capacity, and you enjoy it;

  • are not tied to any one methodology, and you believe that the best system is one that the team came up with, collaboratively; and,

  • are well-versed in the needs of building a complex web application, from design/UI concerns through to building a distributed system at scale.


In this role you can bring a tremendous amount of value to our organization. You will work closely with our CTO, who guides the overall technical direction of the company, as well as helping individual developers do their jobs as effectively as possible.


We are a company filled with motivated learners who take their responsibilities seriously, and who try hard to foster and maintain a flexible, healthy, supportive work environment.  Primarily we use Clojure and ClojureScript in the web domain, and a mix of Clojure, Java, Python and C++ for our machine learning backend.  As far as the programming aspects of this position are concerned, we don’t expect you to be a Clojure expert. We’re much more interested in your capacity for learning, and having an itch to use functional languages is a good start.



If this sounds like what you’re looking for, please drop us a line!

As a software engineer in Amazon Payments, you will have the opportunity to conceptualize, design, build, test and own software systems. You will work in an agile environment in which your code reaches a large number of customers in a matter of hours.

As a leader, you will have the opportunity to define the technical road map for the new team. You will guide a team of engineers to deliver the road map. A successful candidate will bring deep technical expertise and passion to solve challenging problems that benefit customers.

description:
Atlassian is on a journey towards continuous deployment, and our success rests on our ability to thoroughly test and rapidly deploy our ever evolving products. It is essential for us to have the right culture, processes, tools and automation in place. In this role you will play a key part in this journey, by owning Atlassian's Build Grid infrastructure.



Currently running over 120,000 builds per month, the Build Grid is split between internal hardware and EC2 nodes. You will be responsible for designing, implementing and optimising the process, infrastructure and tools to support its rapid growth. These tools will allow Atlassian's world-class products (including JIRA and Confluence) to be automatically tested by tens of thousands of tests and deployed to production within minutes. You will help us ensure that every stage of the release process can be completed in seconds, as we scale to cope with 300k-600k builds per month.



By releasing products every few minutes, you will enable Atlassian to deliver more customer value, and allow product teams to quickly receive and respond to feedback. This is key to Atlassian's success.



More About You



We're looking for a strong engineer with a passion for making distributed systems run smoothly, a habit of constantly challenging the status quo, with excellent technical and communication skills. To be successful in this role you must thrive on planning and managing fast-moving projects involving production systems and cutting edge technology.



We'd love it if you have 5+ years experience working with Linux infrastructure in a high performance, high availability environment. You'll need commercial AWS experience, to be comfortable writing scripts, small tools or daemons in Ruby or Python, and can work with remote REST APIs. You have an obsessive compulsive relationship with testing (know what TDD is) and you're happiest when you're working with one or more of the following configuration management tools: Puppet, Chef, Salt, CFEngine.



You crave data, and you believe that time series metrics, dashboards and centralised logging are critical pieces of infrastructure. You've configured and maintained one or more virtualisation platform in the past, and you're familiar with the dirty tricks they can play.



More About The Team



In this role, you'll get the chance to work in a place where you get to do what you love everyday. We are building a different kind of software company - one that listens to client needs, values innovation and lighning fast efficiency, and solves customer problems with brilliant simplicity. We are not your typical company and proud of it!



This team develop, design and implement projects (software + systems) to reduce customer friction and enhance the scalability of the build grid. We develop, test and deploy changes to the build grid infrastructure and toolset, and Identify, analyse and resolve performance and stability issues. We also work with a wide variety of people from all over Atlassian meaning we can make a difference all across the company.
